loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a strong-willed woman who engages herself into farming business. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC  since 2007 and access its financial services for her chosen business. Recently, she approached the coop for a loan to redeem pawned cocoland.

loans.use: to redeem pawned cocoland

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is 25 years old, is married and is mother of two little ones of 7 and 3 years of age. Her husband is in the sales of cold meats, but in this business he sees a variable and occassional income. It is why two years ago Mariana decided to start selling cosmetics by catalogue and in this way help her husband with the house hold expenses and secure the daily sustenance for her little ones. This struggle has not been an easy one, but the love and dedication of her family she has been motivated to continue one and not give up against obstacles.

She requires a loan of $200 to buy merchandise and increase her earnings and secure the well-being of her family. Help support what Brenda has built with so much effort. Make your decision and help her. She and her family need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos pequeños de 7 y 3 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carnes frías, pero con esta actividad percibe ingresos muy variables y eventuales. Es por eso que hace 2 años Mariana se decidió a comenzar a vender cosméticos por catálogo y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y asegurar el sustento diario de sus pequeños. La lucha no ha sido fácil, sin embargo el amor y compromiso con su familia la han impulsado y a continuar y no detenerse frente a las dificultades.

Ella requiere de un crédito de $200 DLLS para comprar mercancía y poder así aumentar sus ingresos y asegurar el bienestar de su familia. Ayuda a sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo Brenda ha construido, decídete y apóyala, ella y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Haji Mohammad

texts.en: Haji Mohammad is the son of Haji Mohammad Gul.  He was born in 1976 and now lives in District 3 of Kabul. He is married and has a family of nine people. He has a cosmetics shop, which is how he earns his income. At first his business was not doing well because he started his business with little money and only a small stock of clothes and cosmetics. Customers wanted to purchase products that he didn't have available. Therefore, he decided to take a loan. Now he is running his shop more efficiently because he has more products and can better handle his clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S. is a 60 year old widow living in Phnom Penh.  She supports 7 children by working in her small field growing a variety of crops.  From this, she can earn $2.50/day, and three of her children work in the garment factory and help support their family.  She will use this loan to purchase a cow to help her in the field.  In the future, Un S. hopes to save enough money to open a small grocery shop.  With the income she earns, she would like all of her children to finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to help her in her field.

loans.name: Yenis Margot

texts.en:
My name is Yenis F. and I sell meats and seafood at a market in my village. I've had this business for 5 years and it has enabled me to feed my 4 children. I am requesting this loan so I can purchase more meats and seafood to sell. Thank you for your help; this loan will help me provide better service and increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yenis F., me dedico a la venta de carne y mariscos en un mercado de mi pueblo. Este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años el cual me ayudado mucho para alimentar a mi familia ya que tengo 4 hijos.Ahora necesito comprar mas carnes y marisco ya que en este mes no tengo mucha varieda de carnes. Les agradesecere me puedan ayudar para poder dar un mejor servicio y tener mas ventas.

loans.use: To purchase meats and seafood

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is married and has six children. She started a shoe sales business approximately four years ago. At that time, her husband, working as a school teacher, struggled to make a living for the family and they found themselves in a bad financial situation. Her 20 years old daughter helps her with the business and they have incorporated clothes sales as well. Marina, a hardworking woman, wants to be able to continue with her business and to make it grow, as it has greatly helped her cover her household expenses.

Marina is requesting a $925 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to stock up on shoes and be able to help her husband make a living for the family. She thanks your support to her life quality improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina es casada y tiene seis hijos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 4 años la venta de calzado. En ese entonces, siendo su esposo maestro de primaria, le era muy difícil mantener a su familia y no estaban muy bien económicamente. Su hija de 20 años le ayuda con la venta de zapatos y poco después incorporaron la venta de ropa. Ahora Marina desea poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, ya que le ha ayudado mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar y ella es muy trabajadora.

Marina está solicitando un préstamo de US$ 925, a pagar en un plazo de seis meses, para poder seguir surtiendo calzado y poder apoyar a su esposo en mantener a su familia, y agradece mucho tu apoyo a la mejora de su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 47 years old and married with 5 children.  She sells frozen food, plastic rubber, notebooks and pure water.  She has been with LAPO for 3 years as a secretary.  She comes from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since the year 1992.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more frozen food, plastic, notebooks and pure water to sell.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food, plastic, notebooks and pure water

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yean, 59, and her husband have been married since 1964. They have seven children--three sons and four daughters. Two of her sons were married and living separate houses and the other son is a tailor. Three of her daughters are weavers and the other one is selling sweets in her village. Yean and her family are living in a village along Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since 1964. It's a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. Her husband is a farmer.

She is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for continuing her silk production business. As Yean has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure she will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: Rebuilding house

loans.name: Turdikul

texts.ru:
Turdikul S. is 74 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 8 children. Turdikul has been raising livestock for 20 years. He plans to use the loan to purchase several calves to fatten and sell. He uses this to supplement his pension which is very small. Every 40-45 days he plans to sell the livestock and purchase new calves. He currently makes sour milk products as well and sells them to residents of Yavan. Turdikul will pay back his loan over 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Саидов Турдикул, возраст – 74 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 8 детей. Турдикул занимается разведением крупного роагтого скота уже в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько бычков для откормки и продажи. Таким образом он получает дополнительный доход, так как размер получаемой пенсии очень маленький. Каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать скот и приобретать молодых бычков по более низкой цене. Также в настоящее всремя он занимается производством кисло-молочных продуктов. Эти продукты он продаёт жителям города Явана. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 11 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Naranjatic 2 Group

texts.es:
Lucía is 33 years old and has 3 children. She supports her family by making traditional blouses and skirts, which she sells to the women in her village. Sometimes Lucía sells them to other people who in turn sell her products in tourist areas.

With this loan, Lucía hopes to increase her production and be able to distribute her income more efficiently between household expenses and raw material (threads, fabrics, dyes) purchase. The other members of this group are craftswomen.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, 3 HIJOS ES UNA MUJER QUE CONTRIBUYE CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR CON EL DINERO QUE OBTIENE DE LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS Y FALDAS TIPICAS LAS CUALES SON VENDIDAS ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SUS MISMA LOCALIDAD, EN OCACIONES DISTRIBUYE PARTE DE SU MERCANCIA CON PERSONAS QUE LA VENDEN EN LUGARES TURISTICOS, ESPERA SU CREDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y CONTAR CON UNA MEJOR DISTRIBUCION DEL DINERO ENTRE LA APORTACION ECONOMICA FAMILIAR Y LA COMPRA DE SU MATERIA PRIMA (HILOS, TELAS, TINTAS), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ARTESANAS

loans.use: Purchase materials for her crafts

loans.name: Wanyama West A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Cathy M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Cathy is 39 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 8 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Cathy makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Cathy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Cathy is joined in her small group by Joweria N., Joy M. and Sarah T.. Joweria N. has a business selling shoes and charcoal and wants to add to her shoe business and increase stock. Joy M. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and charcoal and wants a loan to buy more vegetables. Sarah T. operates a business selling used shoes and wants to stock more shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean T. is a 35-year-old rice farmer, living in Chvek Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is the mother of three children: one child works as a construction worker, another child works at a garment factory, and the other child is enrolled in school. Her husband, Ork Dorm Run, pictured on the left, collects palm juice to sell. Mrs. Sean T. has already received one loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding purposes, and she is a very good client as she has made all of her loan repayments on time. Because the pig-breeding business is going so well, she would like to start another business raising cows. Thus, she is seeking another loan to purchase cows.

loans.use: To embark upon a new business venture by purchasing cows.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia C. is a seamstress. She makes jackets and all kinds of seasonal garments. Her husband works as an electrician in a shipping company. This work brings in the main economic income that covers the maintenance of the couple’s two children. The dwelling of the family this located in the 16th of July Zone of the city of La Paz.

She requests a loan to increase the amount of her down payment. Previously she has paid ordinary rent. In the future the couple wants to buy land and thus to have their own dwelling.

This is the second loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out permits IMPRO to approve the loan requested by Celia.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia C. es costurera, confecciona chamarra y todo tipo de prendas por temporadas. El esposo trabaja de electricista en una empresa de transportes, de este trabajo provienen los principales ingresos económicos que cubren la manutención de los dos hijos de la pareja. La vivienda de la familia esta ubicada en la Zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Ella solicita crédito para incrementar el monto de su anticrético, anteriormente pagaba un alquiler ordinario, en lo posterior, la pareja piensa comprarse un terreno y así tener vivienda propia.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Celia.

loans.use: To increase the amount of her down payment so that she can purchase land on which to build a home.

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mr. Ravy, 29, lives with his wife (shown in the photo above, next to the family’s home) and four-year-old daughter in the rural Kean Svay district of Kandal Province, approximately 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. For the past five years he has worked as a driver selling soft drinks, a very popular Cambodian beverage, to local shops. His wife works with her mother making handmade clay pots to sell to the neighboring villages.

Mr. Ravy’s mother-in-law is growing older though and currently lives alone. The Ravy family wishes to add onto their existing modest home so that she may move in with them. He has requested a loan from Kiva and Maxima, Kiva’s local field partner, of $350 to allow them to build this addition and care for their aging mother.

loans.use: To finish his house

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en: Sanan was born in 1978 and is married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan (Agdam region) and he has settled in Baku city.  He has been in the cafe business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy some necessary things for his cafe.

loans.use: Buy necessary things for his cafe

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela is a married woman from the town of Derventa. Her husband works full-time, and they recently had their first child. Danijela had been running a cleaning service for two years. However, after giving birth, she took some time off.

Danijela is requesting this, her first credit from Zene za Zene in the amount of 500 KM (US$ 400). She will use this money to buy cleaning materials and supplies she requires to resume her old job. Danijela hopes that she will get back some of her old customers and that she will earn enough income to meet their family's household expenses.

loans.use: To buy  supplies for cleaning business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias, 38 years old, is married and the father of one child, standing next to him on the picture. Elias lives in a small village in the West Bekaa. He uses his truck to distribute and sell various merchandise around his town and from his village's market to another.

Elias needs $US1,200 to purchase more goods. This loan will help his business to be successful and will provide much needed income for Elias and his family. This is the first time Elias has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina C. R., a member of FINCA Perú in the community bank, Lila, resides with her live-in partner and their son, Yasér, who is 18 years old and studying archaeology. Paulina works Monday through Saturday as a clinical analyst in an institution in Ayacucho. She provides pregnancy tests as well as analyses of blood, urine and fecal samples. Additionally, Paulina sells cosmetics independently through Avon and Jessica cosmetics. She takes orders from friends, family and colleagues.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her cosmetics business by purchasing more Avon and Jessica products to be used as samples for her clients and potential clients. She dreams of having a continually growing cosmetics business and ensuring that her son remains in school to become a professional.

loans.use: To invest in her cosmetics business by purchasing more Avon and Jessica products.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 50 años, convive con su esposo, tienen 5 hijos, quienes le ayudan a sembrar y cultivar sus chacras cuando requiera de apoyo. Se dedica a la siembra es la arveja, en sociedad con el dueño de los campos, esta vez ha sembrado de 24 kilos de semilla, que le permitirá cosechar una cantidad de 50 sacos, la arveja se cosecha de dos a tres veces, esta es la única actividad que conoce. Llegada la temporada de cosecha se divide en 50% con los dueños de la chacra, que denomina “sembrar a medias”. A ella y a su esposo esta actividad le permite educar a sus hijos. Nos dice que sería mucho mejor si tuvieran sus propias tierras, ya no tendría que compartir su producción. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará guano de corral para el abono de las arvejas, Felicia ha sembrando papa en una chacra donde produjo anteriormente, por ello no necesita abono adicional.
texts.en:
Felicia, 50, lives with her husband. They have 5 children who help her to sow and cultivate her fields when help is needed. She cultivates peas in association with the field owner. This time she has sown 24 kilos of seed, which will allow her to harvest 50 sacks. Peas are sown 2 to 3 times, this is the only thing she knows. When harvest season arrives, it is divided 50/50 with the owners of the fields, meaning she gets half of what she sowed. This enables her and her husband to educate their children. She tells us that it would be much better if they had their own lands, so they would not have to share the produce. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money she will buy farm manure to fertilize the peas, Felicia has sown potatoes in a field she has used before, so she will not need additional fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her agricultural fields

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmela, socia del BC “CORAZON DE JESUS”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de chupetes, gelatinas y hielos, vende de manera ambulatoria en los colegios porque cuenta con un personal que vende en las calles de su distrito.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como azúcar, bolsitas para chupetes, vasos descartables para gelatina y frutas para la elaboración de los chupetes, además invertirá en ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año para aumentar sus ventas.

Maria Carmela tiene 48 años de edad y 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún está a su cargo. Es una persona amable y trabajadora, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Carmela is a member of the Community Bank "Corazon de Jesus" (meaning, Heart of Jesus). She lives in the region of San Martin, of the province of Dorado and District of San Jose de Sisa. She sells candy suckers, gelatins, and frozen treats, selling to schools while an employee sells on the streets of her District.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase ingreients to make her candy suckers, such as sugar, plastic bags, disposable cups for the gelatins, and fruit to make the candy suckers. She will also invest in the purchase of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She wants to profit from the end of year holidays and increase her sales.

Maria Carmela is 48 years old and she has 4 children. She lives with her husband and one of her children, who is still under her care. She is a very kind and hard working person. Her goal is to make her business grow.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, plastic bags, disposable cups for the gelatins, fruit. She will also invest in the purchase of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Safia M. Rafique Group

texts.en:
My name is Safia and I am a 47 year old married lady. I live in a famous historical place named Yadgar, in the city Lahore, Pakistan. I own a two room brick house in this place. I received an education up to 5th standard but couldn’t study further due to difficult circumstances at home. My husband's name is M. R., who is in the business of food sales. He sells Punjabi food (Daal chawal), and it is famous in the community. I have three kids: one son and two daughters. My son completed his education up to 8th standard but didn't continue his education because he was interested in his father’s food business. My daughters are attending the local school in the community, and both are in 7th standard. My elder daughter wants to be a doctor and my younger daughter wants to be a teacher. I help my husband by preparing food and delivering it to his shop. We both work hard to fulfill our daughters' desires. I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, rice, cooking oil and spices) to increase the income of my husband. 

I am a group leader of a few more members of my locality. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and flour) for her food business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Musarat begum baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Zara baji wants a loan to buy wheels of vehicles to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food business

loans.name: Mrs. That Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan team, which consists of twenty-eight people, is located in Phum Bei Dab village in Kampong Cham Province. All the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. That S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Saom Thea, is a laborer who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. That S. is 42 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers while another one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Moudjibatou

texts.fr:
La dame B. Moudjibatou est née vers l'année 1977. Elle est mariée à MOUDACHIROU Deep et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle mène comme activité la vente des produits divers tels que les savons et omo de toutes qualité. Elle va acquerir ses marchandises à Tokpa pour les revendre à ses clients toujours dans le marché.Son lieu de vente est situé dans le marché TOKPA dans une zone dénommée Gbossodji. Elle a exprimé un besoin de financement pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Moudjibatou B. was born around 1977. She is married to Deep Moudachirou and is the mother of 3 children who are all enrolled in school. Her business involves selling various items such as soaps and detergents (such as Omo) of all varieties. She buys her merchandise at Tokpa and sells it to her customers, in that very same market. Her sales point is located in the Tokpa market in an area called Gbossodji. She said that she needs a loan to bolster her working capital.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of several cases of soaps and detergents

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivorn P., 53, is a widow with five children. She has three sons and two daughters. Her daughters work as tailors. Both of them run their own businesses in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Two of her sons study at university and her other son is in college. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sivorn is a deputy commune leader and a tailor as well. She hopes to continue to support her children who are still in school; she wants to help them further their education.

She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase wood materials to build a wall in her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: Adisa sells plastic drums for water storage and empty paint rubber. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Adisa has 3 children and she lives in Isaga,in Lagos State. Adisa needs a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more empty drums and paint rubbers to sell. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more empty drums and paint rubbers to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a retired civil servant. She sells provisions and drinks and makes more profit from drink sales. She hopes for a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

She is standing close to her husband in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions in Sabo garage market in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business seven years ago.

She hopes for the loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito A. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Marionito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marionito owns & operates a business selling "tuba" or coconut wine. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Marionito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marionito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marionito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marionito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his busines. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. All her children are currently in school. Hannah owns and operates a grocery store where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk as well as body lotions and hair creams.

She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her two years of trading experience, she wants to use the loan to buy more items to increase her inventory.

She hopes to improve sales in order to enable her to save more for the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale in her grocery store

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with three grown sons. She is from the small town of Novyi Rozdil, Stryi region. Galina started her retail sales business about 15 years ago. She sells bed linens, blankets, towels and other household items, which are always in demand in the local market. Galina is well known for her outstanding planning abilities and clear vision for her small business. These characteristics helped her venture grow up to 15,000 Grivnyas in gross income today.

Galina is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her assorted inventory and income as a result. She is hoping the current loan will help her keep the business running and sustainable despite all the gloomy economic forecasts in Ukraine. As a loving Mom, Galina is hoping to see all her kids settled in life and is doing her best to assist them in this. Galina has impeccable credit history, which is another good proof she is a reliable borrower capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her assorted merchandise

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando R. O. de 46 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas Griselda de 17 años y Nanci de 12 años de edad ambas niñas son estudiantes. Orlando posee una tienda ubicada dentro de su casa donde vende productos de consumo, también recibe el apoyo económico de su esposa  Doña Rosalina quien se dedica a la venta de tortillas generando  ganancias de 200$ mensuales, pero el motivo por que Orlando solicita este crédito es para la compra de cereales y otros productos para vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
Orlando R. Oseguera is 46. He lives in the La Libertad department with his wife and two daughters. Griselda is 17, Nanci is 12, and they both go to school. Orlando has a store, which is located in his house. He sells consumable products. He also receives economic help from his wife, Rosalina. She sells tortillas, and she generates $200 a month. The reason Orlando is asking for this loan is to buy cereals and other products to sell in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal and other products

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma L. is from the village of San Isidro Bajo. She is 50 years old. Norma is a widow with four adult children. To make a living, Norma sells a variety of products to local community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately Php 2,000.00 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of  5,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchased additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is sixty years old and married with six children, three sons and three daughters. All of her children are out of school and working. Adwoa works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Adwoa sells smoked fish at the market square in her community. She buys her goods all the way from the Eastern region where she claims costs are lower. Adwoa has been in business for over ten years and would like a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Victoria es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
El sueño de Victoria es brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Love and Truth.

She is married, is 42 years old and has 4 children. Victoria has a store in her home where she sells groceries, an activity which she does everyday.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (US $350), money that will be invested to buy sugar and rice.

Victoria’s dream is to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en: Keang K., 26, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who typically makes about US$1.5 every day, while her husband earns US$3 each day as a recycler. This couple has two young children living at home to support. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Porn Samorn included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 for her husband to reinvest in recycling business.

loans.use: To reinvest in recycling business.

loans.name: Pita

texts.en: Pita C. is from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Pita owns and operates a business operating pedicab transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Pita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so that she can provide better service. This loan will be her ninth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Anne Waithera

texts.en:
Anne Waithera W.'s salon caters to local women, children and the occasional man. She offers plaiting, treatments, weaving and sells braids and hair chemicals. She has been in business for four years and she struggles with power outages, lack of water and lack of funds. She is using the proceeds of this loan to buy more hair products and another blow dryer. Her long-term business goals are to have a beauty training school and a larger salon with a massage room and a barber shop. 

Anne is a married woman who has three teenage children and serves as the guardian to two others. Her dream is to provide university education to her children so they can be employed and self-supporting.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and a new blow dryer

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: S. is 26 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently sews clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with no children yet. Her husband, Mr. Sokea, age 28, is a motor taxi driver (he appears in the picture). Recently, S.'s husband can't earn much income because his motorbike often breaks down and is not attractive. Therefore, S. decided to request a loan for her husband to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old motorcycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 56, spends most of her time managing her rice farming business. She enjoys working on the farm because it provides for the food, shelter, and clothing of her family. Helen is married to Eddie and they have 3 children.

She would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family but she is limited in terms of financing for the business. That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail a loan intended for her business. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, enough to buy materials and supplies she needs for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa Silao Group

texts.en:
Elsa S. is 38 years old and lives in the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. Elsa is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a general store, selling products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May B. is from the village of San Mateo. She is 52 years old. May is married and has 6 grown-up children. To make a living, May runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. May has been engaged in her business for some years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, May joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by May from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Pamella Auma

texts.en: Pamella Auma O. is a businesswoman who owns a grocery store. She is married, 55 years old, and the guardian of three children. She buys her inventory once each week. She plans to increase her inventory and expand her business. She would like a loan of Kshs.10,000 to invest in her expansion plan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda A. is undeniably a happy woman. Being a mother and a wife, she maintains her family’s harmonious relationship. Her husband and her four children are loving and supportive to one another. No matter how busy Merlinda is with her business, she makes sure that she has time to attend to her family's needs, be it at home or in the schools of her children.

Aside from her family, Merlinda’s other inspiration is the opportunity of having been trusted with a loan through ASHI, KIva field partner in the Philippines. Through credit she has accessed since the time she became a member, her dream of having a fishing and fish-selling business has eventually came true. It started off very small and little by little, after each loan, it has grown and has been helping many fishermen in their village.

Through Merlinda’s loan she can buy a large volume of fish caught by other fishermen in their village. Using a motorcycle driven by her husband, she sells the fish in other villages of their remote municipality in the province of Antique. Her customers from the two neighboring municipalities come to their house to buy tons of fish to sell once Merlinda calls them and informs them that she has plenty of fish. This happens about four times a week.

Merlinda’s motorcycle is being paid for in installments every month. However, Merlinda would like to fully pay her remaining balance to maximize her profit in growing her business. Therefore, she is requesting a larger loan for that purpose; some of it will be used for additional capital since growing a business needs bigger capital.

Despite being a woman, Merlinda also goes fishing in the sea together with her husband, wanting to achieve her dreams of giving her children and grand-children a better life. She hopes that through her business proceeds she will be able to complete the house she and her husband are building for themselves, and that someday all of their kids will graduate from college and have their own careers and not the hard life she and her husband have had since birth.

loans.use: to fully pay for the motorcycle they bought on installments

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam Q. is a hard-working man. He actively contributes to the well-being of his family by selling different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, and beverages, in his own grocery store. He has seven years of experience in this field. Islam works from 6:00 a.m. until late at night for his family, and especially for his adorable daughter. 

Islam realizes that, with the excellent quality and customer service he gives, he can expand his business, so he is requesting 1600 AZN. Islam is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mercy Karisa

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31-year-old single parent of three children: George, Kelvin and Grace Wambui. She was introduced to KADET by another client. She has had a microfinance loan before. Mercy sells retail goods and operates a grocery store from which she makes a monthly profit of 4,000 Kenyan shillings. Her customers are mainly the residents of Gede in Malindi town. 

Mercy describes herself as a hardworking woman. She dreams of seeing her children grow up and live comfortably. She hopes to save money for her children’s education from the extra income resulting from this loan. She will use the loan to add more stock of vegetables, bananas and fruits worth 5,000 KES, to expand the business premises with 2,000 KES, and to buy four sacks of potatoes worth 2,000 KES.

loans.use: To add more stock of vegetables, bananas, fruits and potatoes, and to expand the business premises

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor Meléndez C.   realiza su trabajo como Barrendero en la alcaldía de este municipio dándole mantenimiento a todas las calles asignadas por el jefe de cuadrilla.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar la compra de 10 bolsas de cemento para la finalización de una obra que el esta llevando acabo en casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Meléndez C. lives in the neighborhood of Germán Pomares in the town of Somotillo. He is employed by the municipality as a street sweeper. He maintains all the streets assigned to him by the foreman.

He wants a loan to buy ten bags of cement so that he can finish the work being done to a room in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement to finish a room in his house

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga G. is from the village of Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Dominga is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Dominga owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which sells food, daily use products, and variety of drinks in the local market. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dominga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes vive en anticrético, con sus dos hijos; está separada del esposo hace mas de 5 años. Trabaja como investigadora social donde percibe un sueldo que no es muy alto, pero además se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates junto con dos amigas, con las cuales creó una pequeña microempresa; actualmente obtuvieron un contrato para elaborar chocolates por el día de la madre y el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (chocolate, azúcar, esencias, y otros)  y de esta manera mantener el negocio estable y seguir generando su ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro; el carácter social del crédito hace que se lo canalize a través de Kiva y pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives under the anticrético modality (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) with her two children; she’s been separated from her husband for over 5 years. She’s employed as a social worker but her salary is not very high. She also manufactures chocolates with two girl friends with whom she set up a micro business. They have a pending order to make chocolates for Mother’s Day and they need funds to buy ingredients (chocolate, sugar, aromatic oils, etc.) so that they can sustain the business and continue to generate earnings. This is her first loan request from Impro. The social nature of the loan makes it eligible for transfer to Kiva for access to funds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients: chocolate, sugar, aromatic oils, etc.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita D. is from the village of D'Ban in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Rosalita is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Rosalita sells scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosalita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rosalita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lourdes Yaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo departamento de Valle, Lourdes se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan casero como ser rosquillas, quesadilla, torta. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
este pan es bien vendido en su comunidad, en estos momentos no se da abasto para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de los panes.
su pan se caracteriza por tener un buen sabor.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a a su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 43 years old and lives in the Lazaro hamlet of the city of San Lazaro, in the Valle department. She makes and sells homemade bread and also rosquillas, quesadillas, and tortas. She has been doing this for several years and her bread is very tasty and sells very well within her community. At the moment she does not have the necessary stock to meet all of her customers’ demands. She needs this loan in order to buy additional bread-making ingredients and supplies. She needs the income in order to be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, de 23 años, es joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Ronald, es el cultivo de café y maíz, las plantaciones que posee, lo han convertido en un gran productor. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, en el cual pueda transportar sus productos hacia los puntos de venta. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre está muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 23 year old hard working and happy young man. He lives alone in his own house and wants to improve his quality of life. Ronald raises coffee and corn and his plantations have made his a grand producer. He sells his crop in the city of Pichanaki, where he has regular buyers who await his product because of its high quality. He has been doing this for eight years and what he enjoys most about his work is harvesting the coffee, which he does with great enthusiasm. His greatest challenge is caring for his plantation, so that they are not affected by blights. He would eventually like to buy a car so that he can transport his product to their points of sale. This will be his third loan through MFP and he is prepared to make his payments on time and has already begun to save his money. He is a jolly member of his communal bank and will use the money from this loan to hire field hands.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire field hands

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov V., age 22, and her husband, Mr. Sokhim Pan, age 27, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married for one-and-a-half years and just have a young son. Besides her son, Sreypov also has her mother living with her. 

Sreypov has been a garment factory worker for one year and her husband has been a cell phone vendor for one year. He buys phones in Phnom Penh to resell at his home. He also supplements his existing business by selling MP3 and MP4 players and by repairing phones and installing cell phone applications.

Sreypov is applying for her first loan of $600 to help finance her husband to purchase additional cell phones for resale.

loans.use: To help finance her husband to purchase additional cell phones for resale

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene y atiende dos canchas deportivas de Waly en el domicilio de un familiar donde tiene su puesto de venta de refresco, helados y golosinas, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo que depende de ella; vive con su madre en la zona villa tejada Triangular de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para el puesto de venta y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Blanca.
texts.en:
Blanca has two Wally sports courts at a relative’s address where she sells snacks like soft-drinks, frozen treats and sweets. This is her source of income with which she supports her young son who depends on her. She lives with her mother in the Villa Tejada Triangular area of the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy stock items for her stand so that she can generate higher income. This is her 1st loan with IMPRO. The evaluation she underwent indicates that Blanca qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, frozen treats and candy for her stand that she has at the Wally raquetball courts.

loans.name: Angel Alexis

texts.es:
Angel Alexis A. A.  tiene 26 años. Es soltero vive con la mama,  no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Angel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Angel dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de cerdos. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos y para la compra animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Alexis A. A. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He does not have any children. He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Angel is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates on the whole, that in the majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that they have requested from the San José Cooperative. Angel is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and breeding hogs. He carries out his purchases each month in Bucay and sells his products in the same location. He requests the loan to invest in seeds for his cultivations and to purchase animals. He thinks that the credit is an opportunity to do well. His dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house. He faces challenges such as the climate and diseases. He likes sports.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow and animals to raise

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina C. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Martina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Martina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. Martina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Martina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Martina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Martina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan.  Vuth Veok, 41, is the leader of the group.  They all live in Kaoh Chamroeun village, in Kandal province.   They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Vuth is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate vegetable that are sold in the local market.  The business provides a small income to support the family. She has six children; one is a laborer while the others are students who support their parent's business.

loans.use: Buy more vegetable to support his wife business.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina belongs to a small city of Pakistan called Pakpattan. She is a housewife who spends most of her time staying at home, managing household chores, and taking care of her three-year-old daughter. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family. 

Her husband is A. D.; he is in the timber-selling business. He has been doing this business for the last 10 years and is the only breadwinner of the family. He runs a timber shop in the main market where he sells timbers to his regular customers and others.  

It has become difficult for Zarina to manage with just the income of her husband because her daughter is growing, and her needs will naturally grow as time goes on. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can buy timber in bulk and increases his chances of making a profit. 

Zarina hopes that her husband will be able to improve his business with the help of the loan and she will be able to send her daughter into school next year when she will be 4 years old.

This is her first loan from any MFI and she is hopeful that this will become a profitable experience for her family.  

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Zarina.

loans.use: Purchasing timbers for timber selling business

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro  y la socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos, la socia quiere tener un lugar para vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos y alimentos para los animales. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ubaldina belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata," which is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is part of the Cusco province and department. Ubaldina is 36 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities between her 2 businesses. She sells dry goods along with other members of the bank in the market of Huancaro, and she also raises animals such as hens and pigs. She wants to have a place where she can sell her animals. She is requesting a loan to buy dry goods and feed for the animals. Ubaldina is grateful to the people who are allowing her to pursue her dream through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dry goods and feed for her animals

loans.name: Totuhan Rahimova's Group

texts.en:
Totuhan R. is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old and married.  Her spouse makes his living by working in Russia.  The couple has two sons.  The elder one helps his father, and the younger helps to keep house.  The family breeds cattle and poultry.  The business started 20 years ago when they received a cow from the couple's parents.  Business profits made it possible for them to build a house.  Totuhan hopes to get a loan in order to purchase a calf for its further fattening and resale.  For the future, she is planning to make new house repairs, to build a bath-house, to buy a car and to arrange her son’s wedding.

Iltipat E. is 42 years old and married.  Her husband works in Russia.  They have three children: the son is a private builder while both daughters are engaged in farming.  The family breeds cattle and hen.  Furthermore, in their allotment of land, corn, rice and sunflower are being cultivated. From their business profits they have managed to make house repairs and to purchase an oven.  The loan purpose is to buy a cow for its further fattening and breeding.  For the future, Iltipat is planning to build a kitchen and bath-house, to obtain a car and to arrange her children’s weddings.

Extibor A. is 28 years old and married.  She is the treasurer of the group.  Her spouse earns his livelihood by working in Russia.  The couple has two sons. She currently lives with her husband’s parents, who are farmers, brother-in-law (a cook) and sister-in-law (a seamstress).  The entire family is engaged in cattle breeding.  Their earnings made it possible for them to make house repairs.  The loan purpose is to purchase a milk cow. For the future the family is planning to finish building their house, to arrange for Extibor's son’s circumcision.  Extibor dreams of travelling to the USA. 

Maftuna A. is 20 years old and not married.  She lives together with her mother, brothers and sisters.  Both her brothers work in Russia.  The family has its own business cultivating corn and sunflower.  The family has been running this business for 16 years already.  Out of the total earnings they have managed to make house repairs and to arrange the brother’s wedding.  Maftuna’s family needs the loan in order to purchase potatoes.  In the future, Maftuna wants to get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Matilde Ines

texts.es:
Matilde Inés es una diseñadora gráfica que vive en la ciudad heroica de Colombia: Cartagena;  allí en su “Estudio Fotográfico Geraldin” se dedica a lo que más le gusta, tomar fotografías, hacer fotoshop, restaurar fotografías, diseñar, estampar y hacer montajes y todo lo que tiene que ver con el arte de la fotografía profesional; ella se las arregla para hacerle los mosaicos a estudiantes de colegios y universidades que terminan su fin de año , así mimo trabaja en los carnets de organizaciones educativas, estampados etc.
Como madre de dos niños en las edades de 10 y 13 años, Matilde ha logrado controlar su negocio, precisamente para poder brindarle una educación básica de calidad a sus hijos, para que un futuro se conviertan en profesionales exitosos; por eso todos en el barrio Daniel Lemaitre la conocen por su dinamismo contagioso y por su estilo de trabajadora persistente y disciplinada. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará material fotográfico, como lo es el papel, PVC, programa de diseño Pics, Porta carnets,  lectores de memoria, tarjetas, cintas e insumos para hacer de sus fotografías los más lindos recuerdos para las familias. 
Matilde dice que   desde hace 12 años realiza la actividad de fotografiar, pero  solo desde hace 7, adquirió equipos y enseres para trabajar mejor y con más tecnología;  sus principales  clientes son las familias que están ubicado en el barrio donde ella vive  y en sus alrededores, pero también son instituciones educativas de toda la ciudad, a quienes les ofrece los servicios de restauración de elaboración de carnets, fotografías del recuerdo, estampado de fotos, en fin todo lo que recuerde gratos o nostálgicos momentos del ser humano, por eso está siempre atenta respecto a las fechas de grados, primeras comuniones , en fin de cuanta reuniones familiar o social se inventen sus clientes. Su mayor desafio es adquirir un equipo de luces-flas y sombrillas, que ofrezcan una excelente calidad en las fotografias, asi como impresoras y laminadoras; Su sueño es poder viajar con sus hijas para que ellas conozcan toda Colombia y  reconozcan su pais como uno de los mas bellos  paisajes que Dios creò.
texts.en:
Matilde Inés is a graphic designer who lives in Colombia's heroic city of Cartagena. There, in the "Geraldin Photography Studio", she does what she likes best: use Photoshop, restore old photos, design, stamp and mount photos, and do all manner of other things that have to do with the art of professional photography. She arranges photos to make mosaics for high school and university students around graduation time. She also makes ID cards for educational organizations, does printing, etc.

As the mother of two children who are 13 and 10 years old, Matilde has been able to manage her business in order to give her children a high-quality, basic education, so that in the future they can become successful professionals. Everyone in the Daniel Lemaitre neighborhood knows her for her contagious dynamism and for her working style, persistent and disciplined. This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with her CrediKiva she will buy photography materials, including photo paper, PVC, design program, ID badge carrying cases, memory card readers, memory cards, tape and other necessary inputs to make her photos into the nicest possible memories for families.

Matilde says that for the past 12 years she has been taking photographs, but only 7 years ago did she acquire the equipment and gear to improve her work through better use of technology. Her main clients are the families who live in and around the neighborhood, as well as educational institutions from all over the city, for whom she makes ID cards, photographic memorabilia, photo printing, really everything that recalls a human being's pleasant or nostalgic moments in life. This is why she always pays close attention to dates of graduation, first Communions, and other social and family reunions that her clients invest in. Her greatest challenge is to buy a flash lighting system and umbrellas to give her photos higher quality; she could also use better printers and laminating machines. Her dream is to be able to travel with her daughters so that they can get to know all of Colombia and realize that their country is one of the most beautiful created by God.

loans.use: Buy materials for photography, including photo paper, PVC, design program, ID badge carrying  case, memory card readers, memory cards, tape and other necessary inputs to make her photos into the nicest possible memories for families

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther J. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at her bar in Jebel kujur,Juba, South Sudan and is requesting a loan of 600 SDG to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Esther is 25 years old and is married to a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine sells fruits and vegetables. Josephine earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from her business.

In 2010, Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tianoh/go Forward Group

texts.en:
Bendu G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Tianoh/Go Forward.  She is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of 10 to 2 years. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 20 years, she has been selling pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. in Barnesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc.

She describes herself as a hardworking woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum P. lives in Kampong Chhnang province. With her husband, she has been working her fishing boat since 2006. She and her family found that their lives are taking one step toward a healthy family. She has four single children under her roof.  The oldest is working at a garment factory with a salary of $ 100 per month. She is now asking for a loan of US$ 1100 to build another two rooms for her children. In the near future, she and her husband plan to buy a car to take her fish from the river to the market place.  She wants her children finish their university degrees.

loans.use: To build another two rooms for her children

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es: Freddy Antonio tiene 47 años. Desde hace 1 año vende nacatamales en su humilde vivienda. Prepara este tipo de alimento que es algo muy típico en Nicaragua. Con este negocio ha logrado salir adelante pues es una persona que lucha por sus intereses. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos y además se encuentra activo. El crédito que solicita es para comprar hojas, mecates, masa, cerdo entre otras cosas que son necesarias para la elaboración de estos productos.
texts.en: Freddy Antonio is 47 years old.  He has been selling 'nacatamales' (Nicaraguan tamales) for one year from his modest home.  He prepares this food which is very traditional in Nicaragua.  Through his loan he has managed to get ahead in life since he is a person who works hard for his own interests.  What he likes about his business is satisfying his customers and keeping active.  He will use the loan he is requesting to buy leaves, string, dough, pork, and other supplies that are necessary for making these products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris tiene 23 años, es una joven responsable que disfruta de su medio de vida. Su actividad económica es  la venta de frutas y verduras.  Hace más de 4  años que tiene este negocio. Se siente muy feliz todos los días por tener este trabajo que le genera lo necesario para mantener a su familia y negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de mandarinas, naranjas, mangos, melones, papaya y verduras ya que se acerca la temporada del verano en donde la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están solicitándole una gran variedad.
texts.en: Damaris is 23 years old. She is a responsible young woman who enjoys her lifestyle. Her economic activity is selling fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for more than 4 years. She feels very happy every day because she has this this job that generates the money she needs to support her family and business. The reason for the loan is to buy tangerines, oranges, mangos, melon, papaya and vegetables. Summer is coming and that is when most of her customers are always asking her for a variety of products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Class Six Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 36-year-old L. Simon has been in the poultry business for the last 3 months in Kazinga-Mukono. It is still an up-and-coming business that he began with the persuasion of close friends. Simon also has a small and modest rental business that he says is of paramount importance to him too as he looks at profit increment and consolidation. Simon, who is happily married with 4 kids, says this business generates him 225,000 UGX monthly. Simon belongs to Class six development group-Mukono. With this loan, he is going to boost his poultry business by purchasing better feed for his chickens.

loans.use: To purchase feed for chickens

loans.name: Rhodabelle

texts.en:
Rhodabelle is a married woman who lives in Escalante, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling ready to wear clothing. Her husband John, who is 30 years old, works as a pump boy (Shell Corp.) to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Rhodabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rhodabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business operation and family needs. Rhodabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Neak

texts.en:
Mrs. Neak, who was born in 1972, is married to Mr. Poeu. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local public school. They are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice on some parts to sell, and on other parts to feed their family.  Mr. Poeu is also a construction worker. 

They are currently facing an obstacle because they have only one ox.  That is why they want to buy another ox to plow the field.  Mrs. Neak is asking for a loan to buy an ox for their farming.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
