Zubeda is married to a driver and they have three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a beauty salon, which has helped her provide basic needs and educate her children. Her potential customers are women for hair dressing. She dreams of establishing another beauty salon in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. Zubeda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. N. is a 36-year-old businessman. He sells timber to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. So far, he has employed three people in his business.   

He also earns extra income from his rental houses. 

Peter is a married man with two children in school. Hence, he works hard to educate them. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his family's standard of living.  He hopes to open a timber processing factory in the future.  

With the loan of 80,000 KES, he will buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irma es divorciada  y tiene 3 hijos y tiene 54 años de edad , Irma es integrante de la alcancía comunal “ Mujeres Forjadoras” grupo conformado por 10 socios que se dedican a actividades de comercio, Irma  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sabana, cubrecama y forro de mueble desde hace 24 años , este trabajo surge a raíz de ella no quería depender de su pareja ya que el no la dejaba trabajar y la trataba mal, es así que Irma se divorcio y tenia que mantener a tres hijos y puso su propio taller donde hoy en día confecciona,  Irma nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que tocar puertas y ofrecer sus confecciones pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  a conseguido mejores ingresos económicos, una mejor calidad de vida, sus hijos tienen una buena educación y su hijo el mayor ya puso su propio negocio. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar Ganado (vacas y toros) para luego venderlos  ya que es un nuevo negocio que piensa poner. Sabemos que Irma  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms. Irma is a 54-year-old divorced mother of three. She is a member of the Mujeres Forjadoras community bank, a group that is comprised of 10 members who own small businesses. Irma has been making and selling bed sheets, bedspreads, and slipcovers for a living for 24 years. She launched this business because she did not want to depend on her partner since he did not let her work and treated her badly. Consequently, Irma got a divorce and had to support her three children, so she set up the sewing shop in which she currently works. Irma states that it was not easy. She had to knock on some doors and sell her merchandise, but thanks to her dedication and efforts, she has managed to obtain better profits, a better quality of life, and a good education for her children. Her eldest son even has his own business now. This loan is for purchasing livestock (cows and bulls) so that she can sell them; this is a new business that she is planning on getting into. We know that Irma will reach her goals with her hard work and efforts, and that these Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en: Petronille is 40 years old and she has four children between the ages of 3 and 19 years old. She sells foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans. She has been selling these foods for six years. This business has enabled her to bring herself out of poverty. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Grimaneza

texts.es:
Gloria Grimaneza G. C. tiene 28 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura tiene una cuadra y media  que arrienda en la cual siembra cebada, papas, arveja, además cría animales como chanchos, tiene dos cabezas de ganado y ovejas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno en el sector donde esta arrendando.

Le gusta visitar a los padres, ver televisión, festejar las fiestas del carnaval y las del 15 de agosto de María Auxiliadora.
texts.en:
Gloria Grimaneza G. C. is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in the Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. She has 1 child.  

The women's group CARBON CHINIPAMBA community bank is located in the community of Carbón Chinipamba, Cuatro Esquinas sector, Guaranda canton. they are 20 minutes from the cooperative office. Most of the members work in farming, cattle and trade, producing rice, barley, beans, quinoa, potatoes and animals such as dairy cows and penned animals.  

Gloria is a farmer. She has a lot and a half where she plants barley, potatoes, and peas. She also raises animals such as pigs, and she has two head os cattle and sheep. She makes her purchases in the Guaranda province and sells her product in the wholesale market of the same city.

She is asking for the loan to buy materials and animal feed. The support of the loan will help to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and illnesses and weather variation. Her dream is to buy a plot of land in the area she is renting.

She likes to visit her parents, watch television, celebrate carnival, and the María Auxiliadora festival on August 15th.

loans.use: to buy materials and animal feed.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 51 years-old.  She has 11 children who are aged between five and 34 years-old.  The eldest is not in school because she finished high school and couldn't afford to continue while the rest are in school. 

Patricie sells green bananas while her husband is a farmer. Patricie has sold bananas for nine years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to buy a cow which gives her milk and also meets her family needs. She is requesting a loan too buy more green bananas to sell in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to sell green bananas.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 64 years old and married. She has nine children. 

Fredeswinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fredeswinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merci

texts.es: Merci, de 40 años, es una  mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alcides de 48 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Merci es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 6 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. En adelante espera ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es será su  séptimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
40 year-old Merci is a very kind and unassuming woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 48 year-old Alcides, and her four beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Merci's grocery store is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  She opens her store very early in the morning and waits for her customers to come and buy the things they need.  Merci is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  Merci has been in this business for six years and she considers the most difficult part of her work being having to stay in her store all day without being able to go out.  In the future, Merci hopes to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products.

This will be Merci's seventh loan from MFP and she is prepared to make all of her repayments on time as she doesn't want to cause difficulties for her community bank where she is very well liked by her fellow members.  Merci will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Kamiyat's Group

texts.en:
Kamiyat is 22 years old, married and has two children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kyengera in the central region of Kampala in Uganda.

Kamiyat sells snacks, which she has done for six years. Kamiyat is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

To help expand her business, Kamiyat has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase ground nuts to fry and sell.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kamiyat hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. In the future, Kamiyat hopes to own a production business.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts to fry and sell.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Mwanatumu has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a Kshs 20,000 loan Mwanatumu wants to purchase cereals, sacks of beans, maize, rice and maize flour.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future.

.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, sacks of beans, maize, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Silvia que nació en la departamento de Apurímac (Perú), tiene 33 años de edad y tiene dos hijos y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades domésticas, Yo ayudo en la casa y mi esposo Hugo es albañil y trabaja construyendo casas, edificios y otras cosas más. Yo requiero el crédito para comprar herramientas y materiales para ayudar en el trabajo de mi esposo”.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

We met Silvia there.  She was born in Apurímac Department (Perú) and she’s 33 years old.  She has two children and she tells us:

“Currently, I live in the city of Cusco which is also where I carry out my domestic activities.  I help at home and my husband’s a bricklayer working building houses, buildings and other things.  I need the loan to buy tools and supplies to help in my husband’s work.”

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
For the last five years George has been operating a green grocer shop in Ngara. He is 38 years old and married to Lucy. They are blessed with four school-age children.

George was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This will be George's first loan. He intends to use the loan to add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

In the future, George aspires to diversify into other businesses that will increase his income.

loans.use: to add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has had a sari-sari store business for 3 years. She sells eggs, coffee, spices and other various products. Rosalie also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Rosalie requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and additional items to sell at her store. Rosalie hopes to have her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and additional items to sell at her store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Susan has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 15 years.
In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet, es soltera y tiene 4 hijas mujeres dos de ellas de 18 años de edad, 16, 14; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia trabaja elaborando y preparando desayunos por las mañanas en forma ambulatoria y ahora está deseando viajar a Iquique Chile para comprar celulares y repuestos de celulares para traer a vender aquí, la socia traerá de Tacna y de Chile algunos celulares para ver cómo funciona el negocio de la venta de celulares y accesorios, repuestos y todo lo referente a este negocio. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de celulares y accesorios más los repuestos de los mismos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de celulares y accesorios  para la venta.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the "Señor de Wimpillay Choco" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Yanet is single and has four daughters.  Two of them are already women (18 years old) and the other two are 16 and 14.  Yanet is 37 years old.  She works making breakfasts in the mornings which she then sells as an itinerant street vendor.  She would currently like to travel to Iquique, in Chile, to buy cell phones and [cell phone] spare parts which she will bring back and sell here.  She will bring some cell phones back from Tacna and Chile to see how the business of selling cell phones, accessories and parts goes.  She would like this loan to buy cell phones, accessories and spare parts.

Yanet is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying cell phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 21 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Mary Jane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Henry Emerson

texts.es: Henry Emerson, de veinte años de edad reside al Oriente del país en un caserío muy humilde del país, muy joven cuenta con casa propia y en la que viven su compañera de vida Eva y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Haber asumido responsabilidades desde temprana edad ha hecho que Henry cada día sea más creativo de la forma de cómo poder sostener económicamente a su familia,  al no contar con un empleo fijo; recientemente ha adquirido un pick up con el que todos los días desde muy temprano sale a la zona del mercado regional y colonias aledañas a vender fruta y verduras, es un hombre definitivamente muy positivo, responsable y dinámico. Va con su megáfono pregonando su venta. Le ha ido muy bien y ya hasta cuenta con rutas donde lo esperan sus clientes, es por ello que a la demanda que le hacen él desea satisfacerla para no dejar oportunidad de hacer negocios y adquirir mejores ganancias con los que pueda  llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, además de ir haciendo algún pequeño fondo con el que su hijita pueda iniciar su formación académica. Por todo ello solicita el apoyo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar plátanos, zanahoria, cebolla, tomates, ayotes, repollos, guineos al por mayor en mercado de mayoreo a fin de obtenerlos a menores precios
texts.en: Henry Emerson is twenty years old and he lives in the West of the country in a very humble community. He is very young but he has a house of his own. He lives with his life-partner, Eva, and their 4-year old daughter. Having assumed responsibilities from an early age, Henry has become more creative every day in finding ways of supporting his family. He does not have stable employment. He recently acquired a pick-up truck that he uses every day, from the very early mornings to travel to the regional market and the surrounding colonies to sell fruits and vegetables. He is a definitive optimist, responsible and dynamic man. He travels with his megaphone advertising his sales. It has gone very well for him and he takes some routes where his clients wait for him. He wants to be able to satisfy their demand so that he will not have to pass up any opportunity to do business, to acquire better earnings, and to bring home the daily bread. He also has a small savings fund for his little girl, to start her schooling. For all of these reasons he requests the support of Integral (Kiva Field Partner). He will purchase plantains, carrots, onions, tomatoes, squash, cabbage, and bananas in wholesale from the wholesalers market, taking advantage of the better prices.

loans.use: to purchase plaintains, carrots, onions. tomatoes, squash, cabbage, and bananas in wholesale.

loans.name: Ndéye Ndoubé

texts.fr: L'empreunreuse est une femme mariée qui vit avec son mari et ses cinq enfants.Elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la  capitale du pays et revend ses produits dans sa localité.L'activité lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins ainsi que les dépenses liées à la scolarisation et à la santé de ses enfants.Elle participe aussi à la prise en charge de l'alimentation de sa famille. Elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter des tissus "thioub" ainsi que des produits divers de mercerie et d'habillement.Son ambition est de construire sa proptre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman who lives with her husband and five children. She sells fabric and dry goods. She stocks up at the weekly markets in the country’s capital and resells her products locally. The business earnings allow her to take care of her needs, as well as the expenses for her children’s schooling and health. She also helps to pay for her family’s food. She is seeking a loan for 300,000 f to buy “thioub” fabric, as well as diverse dry goods and clothing. Her ambition is to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy "thioub" fabric, as well as diverse dry goods and clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking business-woman, aged forty. She is married and blessed with four children all of whom attend school.  For the last ten years, she has been running a business, renting houses to support her family.  She also practices dairy farming to supplement her income. 

Elizabeth has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.  She would like to express her gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her dairy.

loans.name: Tot

texts.en: From Pouk district of Siem Reap province, a 41-year-old married woman, Mrs. Tot, is selling groceries from a booth in front of her own house. Every day Mrs. Tot has to get up in the early morning to buy groceries from her frequent suppliers at a local market. She then takes the groceries home, selling to the people in her village at a profitable price. She usually earns approximately $5.00 per day from this business. Mrs. Tot has got only 2 children, one of whom is already married and lives away. Mrs. Tot would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a buffalo that can be used on her farmland. For the future plan, she will expand her sales business and sell many kinds of household products.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo that can be used on her farmland.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галина давно пользуется кредитами, т.к. это удобно и быстро. Предыдущий кредит был использован для закупки купальников к летнему сезону. В данный момент нужны дополнительные средства для закупки более дорогого товара - шапок с натуральным мехом. Подобный товар достаточно редкий на данном рынке, поэтому у Галины мало конкурентов и много клиентов, что делает ее бизнес успешным.
texts.en: Galina has been using the KIVA loans for a while since they are convenient and fast. She used her last loan to purchase a batch of swimsuits for the summer season. Currently Galina needs additional money to purchase a batch of a more expensive accessory - hats from natural fur. This clothing item is rarely sold at the local market and as a result Galina will have very little competition and a lot of clients, which will make this venture very successful.

loans.use: to purchase winter hats

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 year old and a married woman with two children not yet in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for the past three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase additional charcoal. She will save her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.en:
Maria Betty is widowed and has three adult children. She is 50 years old and lives in Looc, Maria, Siquijor.

Maria Betty raises pigs in her backyard to earn a living.  She has had this business for one year.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  She has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs.  Maria Betty has been a member of Pagalaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Carlos, es un joven emprendedor muy activo que le gusta emprender y sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos, esta casado, habita en la ciudad de Granado se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y  frutas los colores verdes y amarillos son su mejor presentación ya que vive rodeado de frutos y vegetales frescos colocados en sus enormes canastos hecho de palma seca elaborados de forma artesanal. Este negocio lo inicio por medio de sus padres ya que se dedicaban a la producción de algunas hortalizas y vendían lo que cultivaban el ayudaba a su padre hasta que el se logro independizar siempre vendiendo lo que sembraban sus padres además para  variar sus productos viaja hasta Masaya para comprar otro tipos de verduras y vegetales que su padres no siembran para ofrecer variedad a su clientela.     Así transcurren sus actividades diarias en el mercado de la ciudad de Granada.    
El solicita el crédito para compra de cebolla, papas, tomates, granadillas, chayote, cálalas, repollos. Ya que son parte de los productos que buscan sus clientes y no siembran por lo cual los compra fuera de Granada. Uno de sus planes es asegurar su tramo para almacenar productos y no pagar bodega para guardar su mercadería. Sobre todo luchar cada día por darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, very active entrepreneur who likes to work and get his family ahead. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of four children. He lives in the city of Granada and works selling vegetables and fruits. The green and yellow products make the best presentation, as he is surrounded by fresh fruits and vegetables in enormous artisanal baskets made of dried palm. He started this business through his parents, as they worked growing vegetables and would sell what they grew. Carlos helped his father until he became independent. He has always sold his parents’ products but also adds variety for his customers by traveling to Masaya to buy other vegetables that his parents don’t grow. This is how he spends his day in the Granada city market.

Carlos is requesting this loan for the purchase of onions, potatoes, tomatoes, granadillas, chayotes, passion fruit, and cabbage. His customers look for these products and his parents do not grow them, which is why he buys them outside of Granada. One of his plans is to ensure storage for his products and not have to pay for a warehouse to store his merchandise. Above all, he struggles daily to provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, tomatoes, granadillas, chayotes, passion fruit, and cabbage

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
El comité  "Emprendedora Rosa De Lima " se formo a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio de las miembros. Son 11 mujeres que se unieron con la esperanza de superar los límites que la pobreza les pone y así ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra.  Gloria es panadera, comenta que es muy buena en lo que hace, ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho los panificados que ella elabora, comenta que gracias a su sacrificio está creciendo y ayuda también a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para poder seguir haciendo los panificados, ya que quiere comprar harina, manteca, sal, azúcar, etc. Agradece a la fundación y Kiva por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee "Emprededora Rosa De Lima" was formed through promotions that were made in the members' neighborhood. They are eleven women who got together with the hope of overcoming limitations that poverty had put upon them and in this way help their families.

Gloria is a baker, and she says that she's very good at what she does. Her customers really like the baked goods that she creates, and she says that thanks to her sacrifice it's growing and also helps her family.

She is requesting the loan to be able to continue making baked goods, since she wants to buy flour, lard, salt, sugar, etc. She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a rural farmer in Nandihills, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records lending it the nickname “source of champions”. She is a mother and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten year. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her children, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Esther joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow which produces milk daily, which Esther sells to her neighbours. Today, Esther is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Esther is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. 
Make her festive season to be great by granting her a loan!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is engaged in retailing business in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She finds pleasure in doing her retailing activities and earn as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, Elvie wishes to become the primary supplier of basic and consumable goods in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.en:
Miss Conchita lives with her four children in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. She is married but her husband left them and left her destitute with her little ones, something that has not been at all easy for her. Nevertheless the great love she has for her family and the sense of responsibility have made Miss Conchita rise and move forward. Resulting form all of this, four years ago she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, with the ultimate goal of giving her children what they need to live and provide them with the education they require.

Now she needs a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to fill the orders she has received and therefore provide her children with what they need. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can help her during these times. She and her little ones need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Conchita vive con sus cuatro hijos en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, ella es casada pero se su marido de fue de la casa y la dejó desamparad con sus pequeños, esto no ha sido nada fácil para ella, sin embargo el gran amor que le tiene a su familia y la responsabilidad han hecho que Doña Conchita se levanté y siga adelante. Es por todo esto que hace 4 años que comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, con la finalidad de dar a sus hijos que necesitan para vivir y brindarles la educación que requieren.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene actualmente y así poder brindarles a sus hijos lo que necesitan, ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes apoyarla en estos momentos, ella y sus pequeños te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Xx

texts.en: X.

loans.use: xx

loans.name: Khan Eang

texts.en: Mrs. Khan eang C. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  Together, C. and her husband run a small grocery store in their village.  They are able to make about $7 per day from their grocery business.  The couple has four children, all of whom are students.  They hope to use this loan in order to purchase more grocery products so that they can expand their business.  In the future, they hope that they will be able to further expand their business and open a stand at the market.  Eventually, they hope that their children will be able to go to university.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products in order to expand their business

loans.name: Aloema

texts.en:
Aloema tends to her vegetable garden everyday. It is a hobby that has now turned into a money making activity to earn extra cash to supplement her husband’s earnings. Now that her three children are in school, money is always needed not only for their lunches but also other fundraising activities in school. Aloema earns $200 profit a week from the sale of her vegetables to the local villagers as well as the customers she has when she takes her produce to market.

Aloema is requesting $800 to purchase fertilizer, fagavao, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, fagavao,  cement, timber, sand and an iron roof.

loans.name: I Wayan Sudiartaya

texts.id:
"SUBAK" is the name of the organization that arrange distribution of rice-field water in Bali Island. This inherited from parents organization, started as traditional organization taht only distributed rice-field water. Today SUBAK not only arrange for water distribution, but also to provide business opportunities within this organization. I Made Sudiartaya as SUBAK head plays a big role in these business opportunities. In processing farming needs support materials like: fertilizer: Ponska, Urea, TSP (local brands), and also seeds for plants like rice, corn and soybean. With a capital of Rp6,000,000 (about US$675), I Made Sudiartaya would try to provide those support materials. I Made Sudiartaya would supply fertilizer and seed for 20 farmers working on an area of 15 hectares. The fertilizer would be bought from local distributor KUD in large quantity to obtain lower quantity discount price. I Made Sudiartaya thjen sold to the farmers depending on their needs. Problems facing I Made Sudiartaya are payment issues. The farmers would pay for fertilizer or seed by Harvest payment system (once every 5 months). Only after 5 months could I Made Sudiartaya obtain his profits. Payment were done by cash or farmers production like in dried shell rice, corn or soybean. In 5 months I Made Sudiartaya could get about 750kg in shell dried rice, or when cashed about Rp1,500,000 (about $167). I Made Sudiartaya would like to add more fertilizers and seeds to supply another 25 farmers working on an area of 30 hectares.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

’’SUBAK” itulah nama organisasi pengaturan air sawah yang ada di Pulau Bali.Organisasi warisan dari orang tua di Bali ini berawal dari organisasi tradisinal yang semula hanya mengatur pembagian air disawah . Saat ini Subak tidak hanya untuk mengatur pengairan saja tetapi juga banyak peluang usaha yang tersedia dalam organisasi ini. I Made Sudiartaya sebagai Ketua Subak banyak berperan dalam peluang usaha ini.Dalam pegolahan lahan pertanian diperlukan sarana penunjang usaha seperti Pupuk :Ponska, Urea ,TSP dan juga diperlukan bibit untuk tanaman seperti bibit padi, jagung dan kedelai. Dengan modal usaha Rp 6.000.0000,- I Made Sudiartaya berusaha menyediakan sarana tersebut diatas. I Made Sudiartaya menyediakan kebutuhan pupuk dan bibit untuk 20 orang petani dengan lahan seluas 15 Ha. Pupuk ini di beli di KUD dalam jumlah besar sehingga mendapat harga yang lebih murah. I Made Sudiartaya kemudian menjualnya kepada para petani sesuai dengan kebutuhannya masing-masing.Masalah yang dihadapai oleh I Made Sudiartaya adalah masalah pembayaran .Petani akan membayar pupuk atau bibit dengan sistem bayar panen ( 5 bulan sekali ).Setelah 5 bulan barulah I Made Sudiartaya bisa menikmati keutungannya .Pembayaran yang dilakukan bisa dengan uang kas atau hasil produksi petani berupa gabah kering, jagung atau kedelai. Dalam 5 bulan I Made Sudiartaya bisa mendapat gabah kering 750 kg atau bila diuangkan Rp. 1.500.000,-. I Made Sudiartaya bermaksud menambah pupuk aau bibit lebih banyak lagi supaya bisa melayani 25 orang lagi dengan luas lahan 30 ha..

loans.use:
To buy fertilizer for resell to farmers

Membeli pupuk untuk dijual kembali kepada petani

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Business Description

Angela has been working in this job for 6 years. Her husband helped her get started so that she could work on her own. They now each have their own business, bringing income into their home. They both work buying and selling plastic pipes. Angela works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Recently they aquired a truck which they use to purchase work material.

Loan Use

This loan will be used to purchase recycled raw material for later sales. She has orders for this recycled material.

Personal Information

Angela is 31 years old. She has 4 children in school. She is currently living in her the home of her in laws. Her husband works in the same business, but with different kinds of material. They hope to save money in the future and purchase a lot of their own where little by little they will build a home of their own.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ángela tiene una experiencia de 6 años con su actividad. Su esposo la guió para que ella trabaje sola. Actualmente cada uno tiene su propio negocio y genera ingresos para el hogar. Su negocio consiste en compra y venta de tubos plásticos. Tiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Hace poco adquirieron un camión en el cual realizan las compras del material de trabajo.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima como reciclaje para su posterior venta. Tiene pedidos de este material reciclado.

Información Personal

Ángela tiene 31 años. Y 4 hijos los cuales estudian. Actualmente ella vive en la casa de sus suegros. Su esposo realiza la misma actividad con otra clase de materiales. A futuro esperan poder ahorrar y comprar un solar. Donde poco a poco construir su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of plastics to recycle and sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena S. lives in Nikopol. She sells seasonal footwear at the central city market. Yelena’s grandmother used to work in the market selling clothing, and encouraged her granddaughter to start her own venture too. Yelena has been in this business for two years now, and her business is characterized by high quality merchandise and a favorable location. Presently, her turnover capital is about $800.

Yelena would like to receive a loan of $600 to open a new vending facility, purchase new merchandise wholesale, and increase her turnover capital. She wants to generate additional profit to provide for the needs of her family and eventually build up enough savings to purchase her own private apartment. Yelena is very optimistic. She never gives up, but presses on and remains perseverant in everything she does. Her natural ability to achieve set goals will help her repay this current loan.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru:
Dushan J. is 74 years old, married and has 7 children. He has a High school education. Dushan owns several hectares of land. He wishes to plant wheat. He plans to grind the obtained crop into flower and make bread for personal consumption. He is planing to repay the loan over a period of 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Юсупов Душан– 74 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Душан имеет несолько гектаров земли, на которой хочет посеять пшеницу. Полученный урожай он планирует использовать на личные цели, так как все полученное зерно он хочет перемолоть и использовать на выпечку хлеба для личного пользования. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 11 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
The art of weaving is in the items of Alejandrina, who dedicates herself every day to making delicate and beautiful decorative jackets and scarves. Thanks to these woolen items that she makes and sells in large quantities she has been able to provide for the education and well-being of her children, who are now grown up and have their own families. After her children were out of school and on their own, she decided to separate from her husband, and since then she has lived alone. Her only distraction is her beautiful and noble craft. Her goal is to purchase a wider variety of colored wools to continue producing her decorative items in large quantities. Alejandrina is very thankful for the opportunity to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El arte de tejer se materializa finamente en las prendas de doña Alejandrina, quien todos los días con mucha constancia se dedica a elaborar finas y hermosas chompas, chalecos y chalinas, gracias a estos tejidos que realiza y vende en grandes cantidades ha podido ofrecerles educación y bienestar a sus retoños, quienes ahora ya son independientes y han conformado sus propias familias.Luego de educar y ofrecerles seguridad a sus hijos en mutuo acuerdo, ella decidió separarse de su esposo. Desde entonces vive sola y la única distracción que tiene es su bello y noble trabajo de tejidos de prendas de vestir, su deseo es comprar mayor variedad de coloridas lanas para seguir produciendo gran cantidad de chompas y chalecos.Doña Alejandrina agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de incrementar las divisas de su fuente de ingreso.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities and varieties of wool / Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de lanas.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama K. is a fishmonger. She is married to an electrician and has one child. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her costumers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Sudiartinik

texts.id: Sudiartinik (53 tahun) tinggal di Jl. Resimuka Barat bersama suaminya Badur yang berprofesi sebagai Tukang Listrik keliling. Kedua anaknya Sandy dan Yulianto sudah mandiri, dan keadaan keluarganya sehat, begitu juga dengan keadaan rumahnya bersih. Kegiatan Sudiartinik sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual rujak dan sate ayam dan biasanya dia belanja bahan-bahan jualannya di Pasar Saera. Khusus untuk sate ayam, biasanya Sudiartinik menghabiskan 3-4 kg usus ayam sedangkan untuk rujaknya biasanya tidak tentu, tergantung banyaknya pembeli. Pendapatan dalam sehari bisa mencapai Rp. 50.000 dan itu cukup untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari. Sudiartinik sangant mengharapkan bantuan modal sehingga usahanya semakin berkembang.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma really wants to move forward, and it is this characteristic drive that has lead her to taking home economics classes. A short while ago she started making yoghurts of all flavours in her home, always taking into account health and safety, and the ways of getting the exact products she needs for excellent quality. Her desire is to continue with this work and this is why she would like a loan; to buy more ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Norma, tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante, precisamente su ímpetu característico la ha llevado a tomar clases de fabricación de alimentos y desde hace poco se dedica a la elaboración de yogures de diversos sabores en casa, siempre teniendo en cuenta las indicaciones sanitarias y los ingredientes en la medidas exacta para obtener productos de excelente calidad. Su deseo es continuar con su labor y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.use: An increase in capital to buy more ingredients/Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.name: Claudia Aracely

texts.es:
Claudia was a department store employee, but when she became pregnant, they terminated her and she realized she needed to start her own business since her husband's salary was not enough to cover the family's expenses. In this manner, two years ago, she began selling seasonal fruits with salt and chilli at school gates. She realized that this was a good business. Now, both she and her husband are dedicated to selling their products at school gates.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in six months in order to purchase more seasonal fruits and have greater options for her customers. With your support, Claudia can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia era empleada de una tienda departamental, pero al quedar embarazada la despidieron, y ella se vio en la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, fue así como hca e 2 años empezó a vender frutas de temporada con sal y chile, en las puertas de las escuelas y se dio cuenta que es un muy buen negocio. Ahora tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a vender en las puertas de las escuelas sus productos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mas frutas de temporada y así tener mayores opciones para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Caludia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fruit.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida K. is married with grown children. Her family lives in Kahovka. Zinaida offers medical services. She owns a medical clinic and invests much time in development of her business. Zinaida is a professional doctor. She is very attentive to all her patients. Zinaida's business has been growing since she started this practice 4 years ago. Currently her turnover capital is about $2000. Her monthly net profit amounts to $400.

Zinaida is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to develop her business and profits as a result. She is hoping to reconstruct her office and make it a more convenient place for patients who come in. She believes better quality of service will help her increase her clientele, too. Current financial assistance will be beneficial for Zinaida's business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

This is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Remodel her medical office

loans.name: Rehema's Wema Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, ages between 2 months and 12 years. She has owned a small shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 1am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US90 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more flour, oil, charcoal, and yeast for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Christina.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Ni Ketut Niliwati

texts.id: Sebagai istri seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang pas-pasan membuat Ni Ketut Niliwati berpikir keras untuk bisa membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Krisis ekonomi yang semakin meluas membuat sebagian besar masyarakat mengalami kesulitan untuk bertahan dengan kehidupan yang serba sulit. Namun bagi Ni Ketut Niliwati hal itu justru membuatnya semakin terpacu untuk bisa lebih banyak mengambil peranan dalam membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Ni Ketut Niliwati memilih menjalankan usaha ternak babi yaitu penggemukan yang berjumlah dua ekor. Setiap pagi dan sore hari kedua ekor ternaknya diberikan perawatan seperti memberi pakan, dan juga membersihkan kandangnya. Dalam waktu enam bulan dari dua ekor babi tersebut bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 800.000 – Rp 1.000.000 per ekor sesuai harga pasar pada saat dijual dan mendapat untung sekitar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000.  Dengan hasil dari usaha inilah Ibu Ketut Niliwati membantu suaminya dalam menyekolahkan dua orang anak mereka sampai akhirnya anaknya yang pertama bisa menamatkan pendidikannya di bangku SLTA.  Untuk meningkatkan pendapatan dari usahanya ini Ni Ketut Niliwati mengikuti program ternak babi yang di kelola Yayasan  DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan pada waktu periode pinjaman berakhir.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Niliwati is a farmer's wife. Her husband is having difficult time due to the economic crisis and this makes Ni Ketut to work to earn extra income to support the family. She decided to try the pig farming business. She is raising 2 piglets at the moment. In 6 months period she can sell these 2 piglets for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million (around USD 85-110). She can earn a net profit of IDR 300 thousand to IDR 400 thousand from this (around USD 32 - USD 43). With this she can help her husband and also to finance their 2 children education.

To further improve her business, she is participating in DINARI Foundation's pig farming program where she can repay the loan after a 6 months period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglet (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio es un hombre muy optimista, a pesar de las circunstancias que le tocó atravesar, tiempo atrás, siendo minero, tuvo un fatídico accidente, que lo llevó gravemente herido al hospital, actualmente, superado ese momento, gracias a Dios, nos cuenta, las huellas de su accidente no le impiden seguir adelante, perdió su trabajo en la mina, pero ahora se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, labores que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia.  Es por ello que tiene gran aprecio a sus animales, los cuales ayudan considerablemente en la mantención de sus 2 hijos y sobre todo a que pueda llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.   Es por ello que desea incrementar su ganado, y con ellos aumenta los ingresos a su hogar, espera que usted pueda ayudarlo, atendiendo su solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. Some time ago, being a miner, he had a fateful accident that left him gravely injured and in the hospital. Today he has overcome this incident, thanks to God, he tells us, the traces of this accident don’t prevent him from being successful. He lost his job in the mine, but now he raises cattle and farms, work which helps them meet their family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals, which help him considerably in supporting his 2 children and above all he can provide the daily bread for his home. He wishes to increase his cattle, and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of cattle he owns

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Sek M. lives in the village of Ampil in Takeo province. Further, she is a 36-year-old widow and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend the local school, while the youngest child is too young to work or study.

She is a beautician, but she has experienced problems with her business in recent months. Specifically, she does not have enough equipment to support her business, and she does not have enough money to operate the business. Thus, Mrs. Sek M. decided to seek a loan in order to buy some equipment for her business and to thereby generate an increase in her income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Mery Antonieta, socia del Banco Comunal “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatillas y plásticos en general, ollas, etc. Su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Comercio s/n cdra 2. Sus clientes son las personas de los caseríos y las personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas, bandejas, zapatillas, botas, mochilas, etc., además comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, y pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y así poder satisfacer sus requerimientos.

Mey tiene  52 años de edad, es natural de sisa y tiene 5 hijos, 2 de ellos todavía están a su cargo y quienes son su motor para seguir trabajando. Su meta es ampliar su negocio con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mery Antonieta, member of the Doradinas en Accion (Women of Dorado in Action) Village bank, lives in Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She sells clothing for men, women, and children, shoes, plastic goods, and pots and pans, etc. Her business is located on the second block of Commerce Street. Her customers are those who live on nearby farms and people who live in the city. With this $975 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in pots and pans, trays, shoes, boots, backpacks, etc. and will buy clothing for women like t-shirts, blouses, and other special orders that her customers make. Mery is 52 years old and is a native of San Jose de Sisa. She has five children, two of whom still live with her and are her primary motivation to keep working. Her goal is to expand her business by selling groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots and pans, shoes, boots, backpacks, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Glorioso Village Bank, one of FINCA Peru’s oldest village banks. Juan is 66 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom are now working professionals. Juan runs a liquor store, where he works every day selling beer, soda, caña (a liquor maD. from sugarcane) and pure alcohol. He has had this business for more than 40 years now. 

Juan plans to use his loan of 3,000 soles (US$1,000) to buy a variety of drinks to restock his store. 

Juan’s goal for the future is to buy some land to build a house on. He already has two houses, but he wants to build another one so that his children can live there and will always remember him.

loans.use: Buy drinks to restock his liquor store

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat is married and has one child. Her husband makes a living as a driver, but his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So Sadokat decided to learn how to sew dresses. After completing her training, she bought herself a simple old sewing machine, then started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men and women’s versions of the national dresses. But now she understands that her sewing machine is not good enough to make better dresses. So she decided to apply for a loan to buy a new sewing machine which will allow her to make better dresses for her clients.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Digna Mercedes G. C., tiene 36 años, vive en la Urb. La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, no termino sus estudios debido a que vino a vivir a Trujillo y se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene un hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Digna tiene una bodega, cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía verduras y papas, con las ganancias que obtuvo fue ampliando su negocio a la venta de abarrotes ahora tiene una bodega surtida,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Digna sueña con lograr que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Digna Mercedes G. C. is 36 years old and lives in the Trujillo district in La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the 4th year of secondary school, but she didn’t complete her studies because she moved to Trujillo and was more inclined to work. She has one son who depends on her entirely. Digna has a store, and when she started she only sold vegetables and potatoes. With the money she earned, she began expanding her business to selling other types of groceries and she now has a well-supplied store. Her business activities take place in her own home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Mujeres Decididas II” (“Decisive Women II”), she invested in the purchase of groceries to supply her store. With this loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. Digna dreams of helping her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store.  Digna dreams of helping her son become a professional.

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en:
M. Kahramon first applied to MicroInvest's loan programme in 2009. He lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Kahramon is married and has 2 children. He is a builder by background but livestock brings in the general family income. He has one cow, one bull and 5 rams.

Kahramon has experience in livestock over 4 years and he has the appropriate skills. Kahramon is applying to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months for building a summer barn. Kahramon gratefully thanks KIVA for its help and support.

loans.use: building a summer barn

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en:
Bumi is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen items in her shop located along Ogba Road. She has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Bumi has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for three years. She needs the loan of N100,000 to enable her buy more kitchen items to sell. Bumi is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Hawa S. is a 26-year-old married mother of two children, from Dar es Salaam. She keeps different types of animals, such as cows and pigs, and runs a meat selling business. Hawa works 13 hours per day, 7 days a week, and is assisted by her husband. She currently earns about $100 USD from her business, and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more animals to keep and butcher. In the future, she plans to open another business. Hawa thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and lease-back microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is a party planner and she also trains young boys and girls on how to decorate halls and make snacks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more decorating materials.  Folashade is 52 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating materials

loans.name: Mirzomahsum

texts.ru: Буриев Мирзомахсум- мужчина 28 лет. Неженат имеет среднее образование. Мирзомахсум начел работать  самостоятельно с 18 лет. Он каждый год на заработки ездил в Россию из за финансового кризиса в этом году он не поехал. Он узнал о нашей программе кредитования у соседей и решил попробовать,  он очень доволен нашими условиями. Мирзомахсуму помогает отец и мать. Свой скот Мирзомахсум реализует у мясников. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться
texts.en:
Mirzomahsum B. is a 28 year old man. He is not married and has secondary education. Mirzomahsum began working since the age of eighteen. Every year he would travel to Russia to find work, but did not go this year because of the financial crisis. He found out about our loan program from his neighbors and decided to try it and is very happy with the terms. Mirzomahsum's father and mother help him. He sells his cattle to the butchers. He is very grateful to our organization and wants to keep growing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breeding of cattle

loans.name: Maxima Remedios

texts.es:
Maxima trabaja como pequeña agricultora de hortalizas y productora de leche de vaca sus hijos apoyan en el cuidado de las vacas lecheras y el trabajo en las tierras de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos, con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de ella.
 
Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Palomar (a dos horas  de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca  lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar la producción de leche.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró en los anteriores créditos permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Maxima works a small vegetable farm and produces milk. Her children help her take care of the milk cows, and they help work the fields. This is the source of their income, which covers the living expenses of her three dependent children. She has her own house, which is located in the Palomar community (two hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a medium quality milk cow to increase milk production. This is her second loan with Impro. The good payment behavior she demonstrated on her previous loan allows her to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira G. is the wife of a farmer. She is 44 years old and has four children. Her husband, Angel G., is a rice grower. She also helps in growing rice, especially in land preparation. Most of the people in their location are engaged in the farming business. Their harvest goes to pay the expenses at home and to buy their other needs.

When she learned about CEVI's wide areas of services, she didn't think twice to apply for a loan. She would like to buy the fertilizer and herbicide needed on her farm. With the amount of Php 15,000, she hopes that she can double her harvest.

CEVI helps farmers grow and sustain more than their livelihood. CEVI provides them with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Maria Leonsia

texts.es: Maria Leonsia H. D. G. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis Talpa en el departamento D. La Paz, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas MatilD. D. 21 años, Maria D. 19 años y Bernarda D. 15 años, solo dos D. ellas siguen estudiando, ya que MatilD. se graduó D. bachillerato se encuentra trabajando dejando a un lado el estudio universitario que en este momento no pueD. cubrir su familia. Maria se dedica  a su negocio que es la elaboración D. ropa a la medida, tiene veinte años D. experiencia en el mismo, negocio con el cual ha logrado mantener  a su familia en el transcurso D. estos años, ahora Maria solicita un crédito para la compra D. tela con la cual pueda elaborar prendas para vender.
texts.en:
Maria Leonsia H. D. G. is 41 years old and lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz with his wife and three daughters. MatilD. is 21 years old, Maria is 19 years old, and Bernarda is 15 years old. Only two of them are studying, since MatilD. graduated from high school and is working. At this point, she is putting university studies to the siD. because her family can’t cover the costs. Maria makes custom-maD. clothing and has 20 years of experience in this business, which has helped her to be able to support her family over the years. Now Maria is asking for a loan for the purchase of fabric, which she will use to make clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita A. is from the village of Bato. She is 45 years old. Perlita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Perlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Masorie Progressive Union Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Masorie Progressive Union group. This is the second loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. The members have experienced a vast improvement in their businesses as a result of the first loan and they are therefore requesting a new loan, having successfully repaid the previous one. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses and make better profits so that they can look after themselves and their children.

Umu S. K. (left) is the leader of this group. She sells palm-oil, rice, groundnuts (peanuts), and other locally produced food items. She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years.

Umu is now forty-two years of age. She was born in Kamakwe but now lives in Masorie village where she is married. She has two children: one is now a driver and the other has just taken the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools examinations.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Faamanuia

texts.en:
Faamanuia P. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Nonoa. She is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Faamanuia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Faamanuia has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Faamanuia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3200 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. Faamanuia is now requesting a new loan of 3000 WST, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle for the business. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Faamanuia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle for her business

loans.name: Roychu

texts.en:
Roychu M. is from the village of Gingoog City. He is 43 years old. Roychu is married and has two school-aged children.

Roychu owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community.   He has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Roychu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand his product offering.

Roychu is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina D. V. is now 41 years old and married to Henry D. V. 48 years old. Their two children are John Henry 14 years old now currently studying in high school and Jobert 8 years old now in his primary level. Their main source of income today is their two businesses; the bamboo set making and their fish cage. These businesses runs for 5 years now, it gives them income that they’ll use in their daily expenses in the house and also expenses for the schooling of her two children. Because her husband is a former fisherman and carpenter he manages their business well.

She always use the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in her two businesses like today, she will use it again to buy motor boat for their boat use in visiting their fish cage and bamboo for the making of bamboo set.

Marlina’s dream is that maybe someday she will have their own stall or store place in their public market for selling their bamboo set, so that if this give them more income she is sure that she can send her children to school until college.

loans.use: To finance her bamboo set making business and also her fishing business

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita G. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop). She is 46 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. Carmencita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1600 pesos a month.

In 2009, Carmencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 9000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: La señora Enith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años, 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Enith, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de menú y por motivos de salud, fue que dejo dedicarse a este negocio, hoy en día nos cuenta que con el fin de incrementar sus propios ingresos económicos y motivada por  ella misma, comenzó a dedicarse a la confección de ropas interiores, donde por las tardes se dirige a ofrecer a sus clientes, donde  poco a poco fue haciéndose mas conocida.Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos.Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará telas de algodón, para incrementar su stock de ropas interiores como: calzones, bikinis, brasieres, pijamas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Enith, tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Señora Enith belongs to the communal bank "Sembrando Futuro," which is located in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, in the San Martin region. She is 30 years old, and lives with her partner and her 3 dependent children. Previously, Enith sold prepared food, but because of health reasons she left that business. She tells us that, motivated by the aim of increasing her income, she began to produce undergarments. In the afternoons she offers them to her customers where, little by little, she is becoming known in this line of business. Today she continues with this business, which is located in her house; her main customers are her neighbors and friends. She tells us that it is going very well, since she has regular customers. With this loan of S/. 600.00, she will buy cotton fabrics in order to increase her stock of undergarments such as: panties, bikinis, brassieres, and pajamas for women, men and children. Enith has a cheerful personality and a charisma for selling to her customers. She comments that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization helps women to develop and advance with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials used in the production of undergarments

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao E. is a married woman who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sein Sammuth, do not have children.

To earn a living, she is a farmer. Indeed, she and her husband, who helps her with the farming, own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. However, they have insufficient capital to buy fertilizer and an irrigation systE. (to support the field during the dry season). Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and a water machine in order to address these issues.

loans.use: To improve the business by purchasing fertilizers and an irrigation machine

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 22-year-old single man. In 2008, he decided to work on his own as a home painter after 5 years of experience in this field. He works hard to become known in the neighboring villages and develop his new career. Today, Maher is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase new painting tools to grow his business automatically.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Famous

texts.en: Famous sells tailoring materials to make a living in Agbor, Delta state. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 39 years old and married with three children. He is an honest and faithful LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He has been in this business for seven years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
