Husein is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Husein has been working as a car painter since 2000. Husein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools to improve his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Husein's work is special because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and has experience in the field. However, when he first started his business, he had to face the competition. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
A. Nurali has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Nurali has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication he began his business 10 years ago with a starting capital of $200 USD. Today, Nurali needs to buy additional food to increase the range of his goods for sale. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 4,000 Somoni. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push in order to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell.

loans.name: Julieta's Group

texts.en:
Julieta A. is from the village of Antagan 2nd. She is 44 years old. Julieta is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Julieta A..

Julieta is married and has 3 adult children. Julieta owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells personal products such as glasses and watches. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to buy new stock to expand her inventory. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra L. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Alejandra is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alejandra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: used to purchased livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sreynuon

texts.en: Mrs. Sreynuon H. is a villager who lives in Pou Bay village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller who owns a general store to sell goods in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Prak Chory, is a pig breeder. With both businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living , Mrs. Sreynuon H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business activities. Mrs. Sreynuon H. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in  the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic plates and bowls

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Cherry owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth, de 28 años, vive con su hija y su madre en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez ha estado muy ligada a la tarea de fabricar ladrillos y desde que constituyo su familia decidió que sería la forma de ganar dinero para mantenerse. En la actualidad  tiene su fabrica que administra junto con su madre, y le va bien en el negocio pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten tener una buena calidad de vida. El proceso de administración y venta de sus ladrillos que produce, durante  la época de verano , es mucho más rentable porque el buen clima le permite producir en poco tiempo. Para más adelante comprará otros terrenos para que su fabrica se extienda.Es la 12ava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  como una camionada de aserrín, arena y ramas de árboles que son los materiales utilizados en la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Lisbeth, 28, lives with her mother and her daughter in her own home. Since childhood she has been linked to brick making and when she formed her own family decided this would be a good way to support herself. She has a factory that she runs with her mother; she does well with this business because it generates considerable profits that allow her to have a good quality of life. The bricks that are produced in summer are the most profitable because climate allows for quick production. In the future, she wants to buy more land to expand her factory. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She is also grateful to the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the funds to buy supplies like a truckload of sawdust, sand and tree branches which are the raw materials for brick making.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for brick making.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe Group

texts.en:
Elena is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza y Fe (Hope and Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Elena’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and her six children.

Elena is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza – she is very excited for this opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small general neighborhood store by purchasing necessary products such as clothes, flip-flops and other things.

Elena will use the profits to expand her business and hopes to have enough money to make improvements to her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, flip-flops, and other items for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Hassan M., 41, is married with two children, ages 15 and 5 years old.  He has owned a Genge business (grocery stall which sells Kiwahili fruits and vegetables) for 10 years.  He works from 6 am to 11pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about $201.

This will be Hassan’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to get a loan to increase his Genge stock. EventuA. he hopes to buy a car, which will help him move his stock more easily, and also be useful for the family.

Hassan will share this loan with his loan group Vigae, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Hassan is seated on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es:
La señora Brigith es casada  vive con su hijo en anticretico en la zona 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Brigith es comerciante sin puesto fijo, así es como obtiene sus ingresos para mantener su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumento de capital para comprar productos como contenedores de plástico, escobas, etc., y así poder tener más ingresos.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Brigith is married, and she lives with her son in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). They live in the 3 de Mayo area of the city of La Paz. Brigith is a merchant without a fixed stand. That is how she gets income to support her household. The requested loan is to increase capital in order to buy products like plastic containers and brooms, etc. That way she will be able to have more income. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like plastic containers and brooms, etc. to sell to the public

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.es: Lucrecia Clementina tiene 49 años, tiene 2 hijos sus hijos menores de edad están a su cargo,  ella se levanta temprano para realizar su trabajo  que es la venta de refrescos naturales, chancho con yuca, artículos desechables y bolsas plásticas,  ya que también tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar, desde hace mas de 11 años que tiene este negocio,  se encuentra muy contenta con los financiamientos pues no es la primera vez, es por eso que siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día más. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de vasos, cucharas, platos, bolsas, frescos, golosinas yuca y chancho.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina is 49 years old, and she has two minor children under her care. She gets up early to do her work, which is selling natural soft drinks, pork with “yuca” (root grown as a staple food, eaten fried or boiled) disposable items, and plastic bags. She also has to do the household chores. She has had this business for over 11 years. She is very happy with the loans; it is not the first one. That is why she is always thinking about improving more each day. She will use the requested loan to buy glasses, spoons, plates, bags, soft drinks, sweets, yuca and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Mr. Sokleang K. (pictured with his wife), is 40 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Ros Chea, is 40 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have four sons. All of them are in school.  The family lives in a village along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokleang and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. Sokleang is applying for a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to buy bamboo nets to build a shelter to shield his vegetables from the sun.

loans.use: To buy bamboo and nets to build a shelter for his vegetables

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en: Gusti Ayu S. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this 15-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daya Pertiwi (PK-10262). Gusti Ayu S. is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Gusti Ayu S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Gusti Ayu S. is now requesting a new loan of 1,800,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Gusti Ayu S. 0 (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Gusti Ayu S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Daya Pertiwi (PK-10262). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Gusti Ayu S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Gusti Ayu S. menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Gusti Ayu S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Gusti Ayu S. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,700,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,800,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie D. C. is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Kinura in the municipality of Kalilangan, Bukidnon province in the Mindanao islands. Elvie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells food and daily use products to the local community. Elvie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Elvie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Voir

texts.en: Mrs. Voir V., 46, is a single mother with a young school-aged daughter. She works caring for kids at an organization located in the middle of Battambang Province. She is concerned that she has to spend money for taxi travel to her workplace and wants to save by borrowing $800 to purchase a motorbike. She is very happy and thankful to those who provided her with financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar P. is 50 years old and lives with his wife, who is a lawyer, and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest son currently attends university, and his teenage son attends a local high school.

Batbaatar operates a small wood products production business in his home. He started his wood products business in 2008 after working as a guard at a bank. By managing and conducting his business successfully, he has been able to achieve a stable operation in a short time. He has used his earnings to improve his quality of life as well as to pay his son's tuition fees.

Batbaatar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and necessary supplies for his wood items production business. He is a friendly, responsible and hardworking businessman and says, "My dream is to send both of my children abroad to receive an international education." In the future Batbaatar hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and necessary supplies

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. has a table on which she displays bread, biscuits and other items for sale at Elmina.  Comfort has acquired junior high level of education.  She has seven dependents. Her loan will be used to buy various sorts of biscuits for sale. She plans on reinvesting her profit in her business.

loans.use: buy bread and various biscuits for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose P. is currently in the business of selling various food items such as cassava and maize flour. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food items to sell, including maize flour and beans. Rose is 35 years old and is married to her husband who is a business man. She has five children and only one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell, including maize flour and beans

loans.name: Kitookye Trading Center Society-Kihihi Group

texts.en:
T. Justus, 48, is a married father of four who runs a produce-selling business in the Kitookye trading center of Kihihi. He mostly sells beans, peas and coffee. He started this business eight years ago with savings from his farming business. Justus comes across as a down-to-earth, strong-willed and cooperative gentleman. 

Clients of his business vary from hotel owners, housewives, to retailers. Justus says he still runs his farming business given the fact that it is too a dependable means of livelihood in Uganda. Justus says he has managed to give all of his children an education using profits from both these businesses. The produce-selling enterprise generates 50,000 shillings each week for him. With this loan he says he is going to buy more cash crops like millet, maize and rice to resell. He is affiliated with the Kitookye Trading Center Society Group.

loans.use: The purchase of more cash crops such as millet, maize and rice for resell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La  señora Mónica es soltera y  no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz.
La Cliente tiene una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes para movilidades en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y ampliación de su tienda, para mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mónica is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her parents' house which is in the Vino Tinto district of the city of La Paz.

Mónica has a store where she sells spare parts and lubricants for vehicles.  It is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.

She will use her loan to buy merchandise and expand her store so that she can provide her customers with a better service.  This is how she makes income for her household.

This is Mónica's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies her favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as spare parts and lubricants for her store

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 35 years old and is married with five children aged between three and 13. He owns a small general store which he has had for about two years. The hours of his business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day, except on Saturday. 

He currently employs three people in his business.

Ignace will use his loan to buy new products like washing powder, umbrellas, washing cloths, etc.  

He would like to use any profits that he makes to pay for his children's school fees and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more products like washing powder, umbrellas, washing cloths, etc.

loans.name: Jaqueline De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Jaqueline, tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su hermana y su hijo de 19 años de edad, tienen cas propia, su negocio es un chalet y cafetín,  este negocio quien lo inicio fue su madre desde hace 10 años y lo atiende de 6:00am a 4:00pm, lo tienen ubicado en la unidad de salud de Jucuapa.
Ella necesita hacerle una inversión al negocio en mercadería como gaseosa, pan dulce, chicharrón, quesillo, pan, agua, jugos, con esta inversión estará creciendo con el negocio y ofrecerá mejores y más productos a los clientes.
Jaqueline tiene como objetivo mantenerse competente con el chalet, ganar más clientela, aumentar su potencial económico para ayudar a su hijo a superarse al igual que a su hermana.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 46 years old.  She lives with her sister and her 19 year-old son in their own home.  Her business is a small café.  Her mother started the business 10 years ago and Jaqueline works there from 6.00am to 4.00pm.

The business is located in Jucuapa Health Center.  Jaqueline needs to invest in buying merchandise for her business such as soda, sweet bread, pork rinds, 'quesillo' (a soft cheese popular in Central America), bread, water and juice.  This investment will help her make progress in her business and enable her to offer more and better products to her customers.  Jaqueline's aims are to keep up to date in her business, to attract more customers and to increase her financial potential so that she can help her son and sister to better themselves.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as soda, sweet bread, pork rinds, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), bread, water and juice

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene forma parte del banco comunal “Bíobío”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende abarrotes y confites en su casa, desde hace 5 años.  También vende, los días domingo, accesorios para celular, en un puesto en la feria. No atiende en la feria más días, porque le complica movilizarse con el toldo y la mercadería más días.
Tiene 3 hijos, 2 hijas de 21 y 17 años y un niño de 10 años.
Con este préstamo, más unos ahorros que tiene, quiere comprar un vehículo usado, que le facilite el transporte de su puesto en la feria.
Su sueño es tener un almacén de abarrotes con variada mercadería. 
A Marlene le ha servido mucho trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, no solo por los préstamos, sino también por la asesoría que recibe durante las reuniones de grupo por medio de talleres orientados a la administración de los negocios.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Marlene is member of the communal bank named "Biobio", located in the city of Concepcion.  She has had a grocery store and confectionary installed in her home for the past 5 years. On Sundays she also sells cell phone accessories from a stand at the fair. She doesn't attend the fair any other days because it is difficult to move all of her merchandise. 

She has 3 children, 2 daughters aged 21 and 17, and a son who is 10 years old.

This loan, in addition to some personal savings, she would like to purchase a used vehicle to facilitate the transportation of goods to her stand at the fair.

Her dream is to have a good inventory stocked with a variety of merchandise. 

It has been a great benefit for Marlene to be involved with Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner); not only for the loans but also for the additional support she receives during their meetings (workshops focused on business administration). 

Concepcion is located at the opening of the river Biobio, one of the largest rivers in the Chile's southern region known as Biobio. The region has had an important function in our history, being the location of one of the important battles and subsequent establishments, specifically during the War of Arauco. It is located in the frontier region with the Mapuche territory. Currently the city enjoys a significant economic and demographic development, becoming one of the more important urban centers in Chile with respect to demographics, administration, the economy, and commerce, only trailing behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: To purchase a used car.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children – one still attends school and one had graduated. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and electricity.

For over ten years, she has been operating a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Margaret faces a major challenge in competition from other fish sellers in the market. She hopes to establish a café business in the future.

With the 30,000  Kshs, she wants to purchase a bundle of fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn D. L. P. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Mailyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mailyn owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Mailyn is just starting this business.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Mailyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mailyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.en:
Sharipa M. is 44 years old, widowed, and has three children. She started her business in cattle breeding with the initial capital of 15,000 KGS. She bought milk cows, whose milk she sold to her customers at the local market. She worked hard and managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of 6,000 KGS. Sharipa ‘s family also began to cultivate kidney beans and perennial herbs on a plot of land. Using the revenues from selling the harvest, Sharipa paid for medical treatment for her daughter, who is handicapped. 

Sharipa plans to use this loan of 90,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep and one milk cow. She expects to increase the sales of milk and also acquire new customers. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to broaden her business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lizzeth

texts.es: Lizzeth, de 23 años, es una joven madre de familia muy a amable y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Roy de 25 años y su querida hija Tatiana de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas Lizzeth realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con las ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su pueblo es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre los beneficios del producto para su tipo de piel. Lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen con que pagarle, pero ella paciente procura que sus clientes cumplan con sus deudas. En adelante, espera poner su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, ya que por estas fiestas tiene más demanda.
texts.en:
Lizzeth is 23 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working young mother who lives in a rental house together with her husband, 25 year-old Roy, and her beloved daughter, 2 year-old Tatiana, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Lizzeth sells her beauty products by visiting her customers in their own homes.  She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman which means that she finishes her cosmetics sales quickly.  She is very well-known in her village and people know that the products she sells are very good quality.  What she most enjoys about her work is advising her customers on the benefits of each product for their skin type.  She has been in this business for 1 year and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be collecting payment since her customers don't always have the money to pay her.  However, she is patient and tries to make sure that her customers pay off their debts.  In the future, she hopes to set up a cosmetics store where she can make her sales more comfortably, without having to go from house to house.

This is Lizzeth's first loan with MFP and she would like to grow her business.  She will make all her repayments on time so that she can access further loans.  She knows that she has the support of her community bank.  Lizzeth will use the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more cosmetics since they are in demand right now.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 40 años, es una mujer inspiradora en ganar dinero para así apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Está casada y tiene un hijo.

Ella trabaja diariamente en su tienda vendiendo productos a sus clientes. Su esposo trabaja haciendo cargas en su camioneta. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres y abarrotes para su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea que su esposo se compre una camioneta nueva y que su negocio sea más grande para que sea más surtidor en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old and very ambitious in her desire to earn money to support her family and cover household expenses.  She is married and has a son.

She runs a store where she works daily attending to customers.  Her husband is a delivery truck driver.  She plans to use the loan to buy more groceries for her business in order to increase income.  In the future she would like her husband to buy a new truck; and she also wants to expand her business to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Rosito

texts.en:
Mr. Rosito A. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old. Rosito is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Rosito owns and operates a tailoring business. He has been engaged in his business for over 41 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Rosito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Rosito has successfully repaid a loan of 15,000 PHP. He is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase cloth for dress making. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for the future use and loan repayment.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for dress making

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: For the past 25 years, Nyame B. has been making banku for sale at Elmina near Besease.  She is married and together she and her husband take care of their five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. As a responsible parent, she helps her husband to take care of her home.  Her loan will be used to acquire more bags of maize to prepare banku for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of maize to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Ronald Ivan

texts.es:
Ronald es padre de familia de 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua, luz y desagüe, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén a 2 horas de distancia del  departamento de la Libertad.  La actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura,  ganadería y turismo.

Ronald se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (es un transporte público utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), la cual trabaja en el mismo distrito brindando servicio a las personas mañana y tarde.  Ronald tiene su propia clientela, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos familiares.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos a su mototaxi, para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y obteniendo mejores ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Ronald es cocnocido por ser una persona  de confianza, servicial, respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan su transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 28-year-old father who lives with his parents in a house that does not have running water, electricity or plumbing.  It is located in the district of Chepén, two hours from the department of La Libertad.  The main activities in this area are agriculture, livestock farming and tourism.

Ronald runs a moto-taxi service (public transportation used by people along small routes),  He works mornings and afternoons providing service to people living in the district.  Ronald has his own customer base which allows him to earn a living to cover his family expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to provide repair parts and maintenance for his moto-taxi.  This will allow him to continue providing good service to his customers to increase earnings and give his family a better lifestyle.  Ronald is known as being dependable, service-oriented, respectful and responsible with all the customers he has attracted, in an effort to improve his life.

loans.use: To provide repair parts and maintenance for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a general store. She is married and her husband works as a driver.  They have two children who are 2 and 5 years old. She has been running her business for three years and has used the profits to provide clothing, transport, and education for her children.

Claudine will use this loan to purchase sugar, yogurt, rice, wheat flour, and candles that she will sell in her store. She saves the extra profits made from her business in order to provide opportunities for her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase products such as wheat flour, rice, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en: Haydee is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Haydee has a tailoring shop that repairs and sews different kinds of clothing and curtains. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials she needs, like needles and cloth. Haydee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Haydee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed, like needles and cloth

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 47 años, vive en su ciudad natal en compañía de sus 3 hijas en su propia casa. Hace 10 años tiene su restaurante en su misma casa, fue animada por sus hijos a realizar este negocio por sus habilidades culinarias y así inició su negocio que hoy es principal fuente de ingresos. Trabaja diariamente para preparar variedad de platos, una de sus hijas la apoya en la atención de su restaurante así optimiza el servicio ya que  muchos de sus clientes les agrada que sean atendidos inmediatamente. En la actualidad vende comida de manera regular, lo cual significa un  ingreso estable para su familia. “Me agrada cocinar  y me siento muy alegre de hacerlo” manifiesta Marina. Por ahora sus planes es continuar impulsando su negocio hacia nuevas mejoras. Es una de las socias mas antiguas del banco comunal que integra, ya que son 23 oportunidades de crédito de las cuales se siente muy orgullosa de permanecer durante este tiempo porque  tiene la satisfacción de crecer sostenidamente en su negocio por los prestamos que ha recibido y por lo espera seguir recibiendo. En esta oportunidad invertirá el dinero en la compra de  ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor y en acondicionar su local.
texts.en:
Marina, age 47, lives in her own house in her native city with her three daughters.  She has had a restaurant in her house for ten years.  She was motivated by her children to undertake this business because of her culinary talents.  That is how she started her business, which is now her main source of income.

She works every day preparing a variety of dishes.  One of her daughters helps her with the responsibilities of her restaurant.  That optimizes the service because many of her customers like to be waited on immediately.  She currently sells food regularly, which means a stable income for her family.

“It pleases me to cook, and I feel very happy doing it,” says Marina.  For now her plans are to continue driving her business towards new improvements.  She is one of the oldest members of her communal bank.  She has had 23 opportunities with loans.  

She feels very proud to have stayed during this time because she has the satisfaction of growing steadily in her business.  She has done this with the loans she has received and hopes to continue receiving.  She will use the money this time to buy non-perishable ingredients wholesale and to fix up her place.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Florcita

texts.es: Florcita tiene 35 años, es divorciada pero vive con sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su existencia. Juntos residen en el distrito ecológico de Pichari. Florcita, es una joven trabajadora que  hasta hoy a obtenido muchos logros que es fruto de sus grandes esfuerzos; recuerda que antes de tener su tienda, ofrecía sus productos iba de casa en casa, trasladándose de un lugar a otro, muchas veces sin poder comer bien, todo esto para  darles una buena vida a sus dos hijos. Ella no cuenta con ayuda de nadie, todo lo realiza sola, y el pasar de los años sus ventas  se incrementaban al igual que su mercadería y por tanto le era difícil trasladar todos sus productos. Es por esta razón que alquiló un local para establecerse y poder recibir a sus clientes, y hoy han aumentado y siempre recurren a ella para comprarle alguna prenda.  Actualmente alquila un local de venta en las ferias comerciales que se presentan en cada pueblo, ahí indica que tiene mayor ganancia. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder desarrollar su negocio. Con los 2.000  soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir, para así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Florcita is 35 years old.  She is divorced but lives with her two children who are her reason for living.  They live together in the ecological district of Pichari.  Florcita is a hard-working young woman.  So far, she has obtained many achievements as a result of her hard work.  She recalls that before she had her store, she offered her products door-to-door, carrying them from one place to another. Very often, she was not able to eat well.  She did all this to give her two children a better life.  She didn’t have help from anyone; she did everything alone.  

Over the years, her sales increased, as did her merchandise.  Therefore, it was difficult for her to carry all of her products.  It is for this reason that she rented a locale to establish herself and be able to receive her customers.  Today, the number of her customers has grown and they always turn to her to buy a garment.  Currently, she rents a sales locale at the trade fairs that are held in each town. She indicates that she has better profits there. 

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She hopes for the support of each one of you to be able to develop her business.  With the 2,000 soles that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more clothing, and thus fulfill her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Mrs. Nay, 55, is living in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband have been married for a long time. Both of them are farmers. They have five children, only one of whom is married. 

Seeing the good season this year, Mrs. Nay would like to borrow some funds to help her family. She asks for $75 to purchase seed and fertilizer. In the future, she hopes that she will be able to purchase a new plowing machine, repair her house, and most of all give all her children a high level of education. She appears in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Araceli  estudio hasta  tercer grado  de la primaria , y tiene un total  de tres hijos  una mujer y dos varones .Ella se dedica  a la  venta de ropa , tiene   cuatro años  vendiendo  ropa  , tiene  muy buenos clientes ya que  la ropa las da en pagos , es una señora  muy trabajadora  en las noches  se dedica a vende antojitos mexicanos.
Sus hijos  le ayudan   atendiendo  a los clientes  y limpiando las mesas , doña Araceli esta muy agradecida con su esposo  Héctor  por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante  ya que cuando se trata  de  problemas hay esta el para apoyarla.
Sus clientes le recomiendan que ponga una tienda de ropa ya que vende  ropa  muy bonita , para toda ocasión y tiene buenos gustos  cuando pide ropa extra.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para  comprar mas ropa  y obtener mas ganancias  para  construir su tienda .
 Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Araceli studied through the third grade of primary school and has a total of three children; a daughter and two sons.  She works selling clothes.  She has been selling clothes for four years.  She has very good customers and gives them the clothes in return for payment.  She is a hardworking woman who works in the evenings selling Mexican food.  Her children help her with serving customers and clearing tables.  Señora Araceli is very grateful to her husband Hector for the support he has given her in getting ahead in life, because when it comes to problems, he is there to support her.

Her customers have recommended that she get a clothes shop because she sells very nice clothes for every occasion, and has good taste when she requests additional clothing.  She asked for the loan to buy more clothes and get more profits to build her store.

She thanks the foundation for the support that it has given her to get ahead in life and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 35 years old, has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.  This will be Peter's third loan, with which he plans to renew the insurance cover for his motorcycle. 

In future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will use to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To renew insurance cover for his motorcycle

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 40 years old and married with three sons and four daughters. She lives in Al-Samou near Hebron City in Palestine. Her husband and one of her sons are employed with decent salaries. Fatima has a project making embroidery to sell. She wants to purchase a large quantity of beads for embroidery but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 400 from FATEN.  When Fatima gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will buy the needed amount of beads and make extra quantities of embroidery to sell. This will increase the family income, which helps them to live in better life conditions. Fatima is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase beads for embroidery.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Bakari, who is in his early 30's, is married with one small child.  He has been selling mosquito nets for three years now.  He works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start building his small house, bought window frames, door frames and increased on the mosquito net stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more mosquito nets to sell and iron sheets for the house he is building. His dream is to one day be able to open a hardware shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Utulivu" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more mosquito nets to sell and iron sheets for the house he is building.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salchipapas que es un plato a base de papas y salchichas, ella tiene una carreta donde vende las salchipapas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de salchipapas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papas y salchichas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank, "Tres de Mayo de Poroy."  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Sonia, she is 36 years old, cohabiting, and has 3 children.  Sonia alternates her daily activities with the her business of selling salchipapas, which is a dish of potatoes and sausages.  She has a cart where she sells the salchipapas door to door from 4:00 am until 11:00 pm.  Through this business, Sonia raises her children.  Sonia wants to expand the business of selling salchipapas so she is requesting the loan to buy potatoes and sausage in bulk.

Sonia is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and sausage in bulk.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Monfory

texts.es: Manfory, tiene la edad de 26 años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende comprar con el crédito los insumos para la asistencia de la siembra de maíz y frijol. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo, por lo cual ella realizo la siembra para generar ganancias de este terreno. Ella tiene como meta aumentar la producción de cosecha con esta asistencia y así aumentar las ganancias para su bienestar familiar y poder darle a su esposo la ayuda extra para salir adelante con las responsabilidades del hogar. También piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere poder darles a sus hijos el estudio en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
26-year old Manfory lives with her husband and two children, the most important people in her life. 

With the money from the loan she plans to buy supplies to help with her maize and bean crops. She has good land which she uses to grow crops and earn money. Manfory’s goal is to increase production so the extra money she earns can be used to support her family and help her husband pay the household expenses.

She is also thinking about her children’s future and wants to be able to provide them with a good education. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she has not had any other loans from state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering her good credit facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to grow maize and beans

loans.name: Ramón De Jesús

texts.es: Ramón de Jesús hace más de 25 años descubrió un arte que hasta ahora le ayuda para vivir. El trabajo con materiales como la Guadua y la Cabuya, hacen que este gran emprendedor demuestre las ganas y el entusiasmo en cada trabajo que realiza en su pequeño local desde hace 4 años que tiene su propio negocio. Con las ganas de poderle seguir ayudando a su madre, ya muy anciana, este gran emprendedor y hábil artesano invertirá el préstamo en la compra de la guadua y la cabuya, materia prima necesaria para poder cumplirle a sus clientes de manera eficiente y a tiempo.
texts.en: 25 years ago, Ramón de Jesús discovered an art which, up to now, has helped him to survive.  He works with materials such as bamboo and pita fiber.  This great entrepreneur shows his desire and enthusiasm in every work of art that he creates in his small premises in which he has run his own business for four years now.  With the desire to continue helping his mother, who is now very old, this great entrepreneur and talented artist will invest his loan in buying bamboo and pita fiber.  These are the raw materials that he needs to meet his customers' demands efficiently and on time.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as bamboo and pita fiber

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a hardworking business man aged 28 years-old and he is unmarried. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last one year to make a living. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the  next five years, he plans  to transform his business from a motorbike to a van transport business. Anthony is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jemalin

texts.en:
Jemalin is 25 years old and presently lives in San Pedro, Dumingag, in the province of Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children and has had a farm for more than 4 years.

Jemalin has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for her farm. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 2 years. She hopes to earn a lot from her farm and to be able to provide her family with a better future with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn production

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.en:
Maria Reyna is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Reyna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Maria Reyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Reyna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha, 42, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past four years Zulekha has sold juice to earn a living, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is one of seasonality in her business.

Zulekha decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a loan of 20,000 KES she wants to realize her dream of establishing another eatery. For this she needs to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and rice so as to open a new eatery.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, 41, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elma has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables for her business.

Elma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es una señora amable, trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  bicicletas desde hace  un año.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Macario, quien la ayuda en lo que se pueda ya que el se tiene que ir a trabajar, trabaja de albañil para ofrecerle  una mejor vida.
Magdalena tambien se dedica a la venta de comida, sin embargo esta vez pidió el préstamo para la compra de  bicicletas y refacciones de bicicletas para la venta  ya que se venden muy bien y deja buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyándola para seguir  con su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a friendly, hardworking woman who has been selling bicycles for a year. 

She is happily married to Macario, who helps her with what he can, since he has to go to work. He works as a bricklayer so that he can offer her a better life.

Magdalena also works selling food. However, this time, she is asking for the loan for the purchase of bicycles and spare parts to sell, since she sells them very well and makes a good profit. 

She is thankful to the foundation for helping her continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old, married and has five children, four whom are still in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.en:
Karina Elizabeth lives with her husband in Monclova, Coahuila. They have just become a family and they have many expenses, but with many sacrifices they were able to acquire a small house that they are still paying for. Karina when she saw her husband working so much and still was not able to meet all the payments, she decided to start selling products through catalogue. The love and devotion to her husband have allowed her to continue with her project. But now she needs a loanof $250 to be able to fill her orders and this way manage to increase her sales.

It is time that you help Karina to reach her dream of having a proper house and have a roof over the head of their future children. The decision is in your hands, you can help them. She will be sincerely grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina Elizabeth vive con su esposo en Monclova, Coahuila. Ellos acaban de formar una familia, y enfrentan muchos gastos, pues con muchos esfuerzos adquirieron una pequeña casita que aún están pagando. Karina al ver que se marido trabajaba mucho y aun así no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos lo pagos, decidió ayudarlo y comenzó, hace un año a vender productos por catálogo. El amor y fiel compromiso con su pareja, han logrado que ella continué con su proyecto. Pero hora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que enfrenta y de ésta manera lograr incrementar sus ventas.

Es momento de que ayudes a Karina a lograr el sueño de tener una casita propia y así poder asegurar un techo para sus futuros hijos. La decisión esta en tus manos, tu puedes ayudarlos, ella te lo agradecedará sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina Lives in the regional center of Floresti but owns a bar in Baranesti, a village on the outskirt of the city. The village of Baranesti is a medium size village with 7000 people, no running water and no gas. Valentina studied accounting in the capitol of Moldova, Chisinau and worked as an accountant for 15 years in a different regional center before deciding to go into business for herself.

Valentina is 40 years old and married. Her husband works in the Army, they have 2 boys ages 18 and 19. She named her bar “Valentina’s” and sells beer and spirits, snacks, and cigarettes. Valentina needs a loan to purchase materials to make repairs and add a terrace on her bar to make it enjoyable for all now that spring is finally here. Valentino has owned this bar for only 9 months and is determined to make it a success.

loans.use: To purchase material to construct a terrace for her bar

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan has been affected for many years by a condition that makes it very difficult for him to speak normally, and communication problems have been a major hindrance in his life. He was born and raised in the city of Cahul, where he graduated from both high school and a technical college. After his education, he tried repeatedly to find employment but was refused by all the workplaces he applied to. Discouraged but not ready to give up, Ivan has decided to open his own business in repairing shoes, drawing on his education and the instruction he received in childhood from his father. He studied the local market and observed that there was no such service available anywhere in his neighborhood; he then began working and found many eager clients. He would like to take a loan to purchase a small kiosk in which to work, having already received the necessary permits from city hall and ready to begin working hard!

loans.use: To purchase a store location

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 34 years old and has small shop for cosmetics in Kirkuk. His wife works with him in the shop. He is applying to get $1200 to paint the shop and purchase new goods and do some advertising. He wants to develop this family business and enhance his children's life.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop, purchase new goods, and so some advertising

loans.name: Yeyet

texts.en: Yeyet is 37 years old and is married. She has no children and lives with her nephew. She is a tailor. She usually earns $7 a day and it's just enough for her daily needs. Her husband Dedi is a driver with a small income. She is a member of MBK, though which she requests a $100 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 25 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Samir owns and operates a small food market in Saatli town; he has been in this business for 5 years. The business is stable because Samir has been collecting his customers over the time he has been running this shop. Unfortunately, he has no capital to invest to diversify his inventory, increase turnover and thereby the income to provide all the necessities of life. Comercial banks demand collateral to give Samir credit, but Samir has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, where we disburse loans without demanding collateral. Samir has requested a loan of US$ 500. This loan would allow him to buy and sell bigger amounts of goods and to develop his business for the good of his family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory and thus his profit

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elsa is a member of a communal bank called Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotros. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 62 years old and separated from her husband, but the support she receives doesn't cover everything. She used her first loan to begin selling meals and drinks.

She gets up at dawn to prepare her food. She takes it to her stand where her customers wait for her to arrive with her delicious meals. In the afternoons she sells sweets from her home. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy rice, oil, sugar, noodles, as well as other items.

Even though she suffered a tragedy when her only son died, she had the strength to continue. She told us that life gives her happiness and also pain, and the greater they are, there is also always a ray of hope and a reason to live. In Manuela Ramos she has found friends with whom she can share moments of happiness.

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr. Ocatavio Monte Verde 437, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es separada, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Elsa, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de comidas y golosinas. Actualmente Elsa se levanta de madrugada para preparar sus comidas y dirigirse a su puesto de venta donde sus clientas esperan con ansias su llegada por las ricas comidas que a diario prepara, y en la tardes vende golosinas en la esquina de su casa. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 sacos de arroz, 1 galones de aceite, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideos, además invertirá S/. 50 soles diarios en la compra de otros insumos y S/. 30 en golosinas. Elsa, a pesar de haber perdido a su único hijo, tuvo fuerzas para seguir adelante, nos dijo que la vida te da alegrías pero también penas y que por más grandes que sean, siempre hay una luz de esperanza y una razón de vivir, en Manuela Ramos encontró muchas amigas con las cuales comparte lindos momentos de alegría.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ITEMS SUCH AS RICE, OIL, SUGAR, NOODLES AND SWEETS TO CONTINUE RUNNING HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
We find 62 year old María in her small home happily preparing her delicious and varied potajes (vegetable stews, often made with chick peas) so that she can later sell them in the Laguna Terminal market in the city of Juliaca. She is the mother of two children, 26 and 20 years old, who support her unconditionally in her noble labor. For many years she worked as a craftswoman, but her agility and skill for weaving chompas (typical garments of Peru) decreased as she grew older. For this reason she decided to dedicate herself to selling prepared foods. The business is bringing her a good income and with her earnings she plans to renovate her small house, a project that has been waiting for years. To finalize her plans she wants to obtain a loan which she will invest innthe repair of her home. With your unselfish support she will be able to finalize her project in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Maria de 62 años de edad en su pequeño domicilio preparando muy contenta sus deliciosos y variados potajes para luego ponerlos en venta en el mercado, Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella es madre de dos hijos de 26 y 20 años de edad quienes la apoyan incondicionalmente en su noble labor.Ella durante muchos años estaba dedicada a la labor artesanal, pero su agilidad y habilidad para el tejido de chompas fueron disminuyendo conforme pasaban los años, por esa razón es que decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida, esta actividad le viene generando buenos ingresos y con las ganancias que ha ido obteniendo tiene pensado refaccionar su casita que por muchos años ha estado suspendida.Para concretar sus planes desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que tiene pensado invertir en el arreglo de su vivienda. Con tu apoyo desinteresado en muy corto tiempo podrá concretar su proyecto.

loans.use: Renovation of her small house.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng N.,40, works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area and makes on average about $5 each day in revenue. Her husband works driving a motor-taxi (a trailer attached to a motor-bike to transport passengers) and earns about $6 each day in income.

This couple doesn’t have any children. They expect to use this loan to expand their grocery inventory by adding more products to meet their customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy F. is married and has four children. He buys fish on the docks of Elmina (a small fishing village 5 km from Cape Coast) and then travels to the Volta and Ashanty regions to sell his smoked fish. He is requesting a loan of $525.00 to buy fish in bulk so he can get a discounted price and stop using credit to buy his supplies. Sammy is hoping this will increase his profits and he’ll be better able to provide for his family.

Sammy is also a member of a lending group called, “Mawunyo Traders”, which consists of 13 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk at a discount and stop using credit to buy his supplies

loans.name: B.

texts.id:
S., apart from as seller of second-hand things, she is also professional of beads tailor, she could make sandals, clothes or anything that could be created from the beads decoration.

She usually takes beads from Garment around his localities then afterwards she is sewing and circulated the item to buyers around her. She took the profit from the cost of sewing and also from circulation.

For sandals, usually S. is paid Rp.2.500 per the pair, whereas the selling cost is usually Rp.500 per the pair.

She is using the motorcycle and the cart to circulating the item. S. really expected help to increase capital of her efforts to buy second-hand things and to increase her capital

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Carlos Patriawan, Kiva Volunteer.

S., selain sebagai seorang pengumpul barang-barang bekas, ia juga berprofesi sebagai penjahit mote, bisa berupa sandal, baju atau apa saja yang bisa diberi hiasan mote. Ia biasanya mengambil mote dari Garment disekitarnya lalu kemudian dijahit dan diedarkan ke pembeli-pembeli disekelilingnya. Keuntungan yang didapat bisa dari ongkos jahit dan juga dari ongkos mengedarkan. Khusus untuk sandal, biasanya S. dibayar Rp.2.500 per pasang, sedangkan ongkos mengedarkan biasanya Rp.500 per pasang. Sehari-harinya sepeda motor dan gerobak adalah sarana yang digunakan oleh S.. S. sangat mengharapkan bantuan untuk menambah modal usaha membeli barang-barang bekas dan untuk menambah modal menjahit sandal mote.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is very grateful that, with her previous Kiva loan, she was able to increase her stock of palm oil and peanuts. She invested the profit in purchasing more peanuts and sold them in Freetown. Her business expanded, and she is able to supplement her husband's meager income to help with family expenses. Fatmata is thankful to Kiva and would like the Le.800,000 loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en:
Noemi, a member of the Village Bank Arco Iris, is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Noemi visits the fairs of the region where she buys cereal, cheese, hens, and other products to sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, she makes cereals out of flour as well as a variety of breads in a rented oven, selling them in the city of Pisco, which is six hours from Ayacucho. Noemi also sells firewood from her home. She needs a loan of $350, money which she will invest in the purchase of flour, wheat, barley and corn.

Noemi´s dreams are that her children become professionals and that she have an established business in her house so she can stay close to her children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, wheat, barley and corn.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena started her business to get ahead, since her husband’s earnings were not enough to meet the family’s living expenses given that his work is not steady. She saw a need to do something on her own, so she started her business three years ago. At first, she only sold baby clothing on order and gave small presentations for friends and neighbors or sold her goods door-to-door. She was always looking for a way to generate sales and, thanks to this, she has gotten ahead.

She needs a loan of $300 USD, which she’ll repay in four months, to buy merchandise so she can make more presentations. Also, the wait time for her customers’ orders to be filled will be shorter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena inició el negocio para salir adelante por por nececidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo no tenia un trabajo fijo, entonces ella se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante por si misma y emprendio su negocio hace 3 años, primero solo vendia ropa para bebe, sobre pedidos y realizaba pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o bien vendia casa por casa, ella siempre estaba buscando la manera de generar ventas y gracias a esto ha salido adelente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancia y asi podra realizar demostraciones, ademas el tiempo de espera para un pedido sera menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a single woman with a one-year-old child. She owns and has run a small food shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US90 from her sales.

Magreth now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory, including rice, maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Arafa's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en:
Arafa is 40 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 20. She has been a charcoal and chapati seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Arafa now requests a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, a retail shop, firewood and banana sales.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding her current stock.

loans.name: Umaru J.

texts.en:
Umaru J. B. was born in Kabala. He is 38 years old. He is married to a business woman and they have three children: one in secondary school and two in primary school. He is a businessman in Kabala, selling cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.
