Umaru previously received a loan of Le 2,000,000.00 from Kiva through SMT, a loan he repaid successfully. That loan helped him a lot by enabling him to increase the size of his business and the profit he makes.

Umaru is now seeking a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to further improve his business. With this loan, he will travel to Freetown to buy more commodities at cheaper prices. In this way, he will be able to maximize his profit and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand his business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. lives in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares for cultivating rice. Unfortunately, she now faces a small problem on her plantation as the soil is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Mao, is a buffalo breeder.

Mrs. Oun S. is 30 years old and the mother three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of two years. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Mame Fatim

texts.fr: K. Mame Fatim, mariée et mère de 03 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce d’arachide et du sucre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
K. Mame Fatim is married and the mother of three children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her commerce in peanuts and sugar. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Warama

texts.en:
Warama S. is thirty years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school, due to the help of government free compulsory education for every child. However, she is still constrained by inadequate funds to make business progress. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Warama has run this business for three years; she uses the proceeds to cater for her household needs. She travels to Kumasi which is one of the busiest markets to buy her stock of goods. Warama belongs to the community group called Kingdom Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, etc.  for re-sale

loans.name: Haysam

texts.en:
Haysam is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Haysam has been working as a constructor for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Haysam has requested a loan.

His clients are his neighbors and the people for his area. When he first started his business, he didn’t have much start-up capital. Haysam decided on doing this business because of his experience in it. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hán năm nay 51  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con trong đó có một con đã đi làm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Năm 2001 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng ăn . Đến nay sau 8 năm công việc chăn nuôi , kinh doanh của gia đình chị phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm một số loại đồ uống giải khát phục vụ nhu cầu của khách hàng và mua thêm thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 51 years old. She is living with her husband and 2 children - one of the children is employed. Before joining TYM Fund, the main source of income of her family were from raising livestock and farming. In 2001, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to open a restaurant. After 8 years, livestock raising and restaurant business have been going well and bring an income of VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wished to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more beverages to sell to customers, and to buy more foods for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages to sell, buy foods for livestock

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members. Its leader, N., 34, is a widowed mother of two children: both of them are students. She has owned a shop providing food from morning till late afternoon since 2001. She is famous for she is good at cooking food and her service is good; she attracts a lot of customers with her food.

Because her business is located on a busy corner, she now wants to increase her income for her children's needs. So N. is looking for a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business and a bicycle for her child to ride to school. The loan will help the family have a more comfortable living.

The other members of the group are:

S., 25, who owns a grocery store and is looking for a loan to buy more inventory for her store;

S. R., 26, who works in a pure drinking water company and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for his work; K., 24, who is a local farmer and is taking a loan to buy rice in bulk to stock in her stall; and P., 37, who is a local farmer and is taking a loan to buy pigs for her pig pen. K. was not available for the photograph so his wife's picture was taken instead.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for her business and a bicycle for her child to ride to school

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher A. is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing for women at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been self-employed for the past 4 years. Business has been good for Alisher. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, more people have been able to afford new clothing. Alisher is not married yet. He dreams of building his own house and making a happy and friendly family. Alisher has requested a loan of $2000 USD to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Alisher hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, new Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for sale

loans.name: Laulam Group

texts.en:
Laulam is the group leader of Laulam group. There are four members in this group. They all want to expand and advance their businesses. Laulam wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop.  Mustafa wants to take out a loan for a car painting business. Roshan Gul wants to take out a loan for a business of selling clothing. Badam Gul wants to take out a loan for a tailoring business. 

They request a group loan of $850 for the term of 9 months. They all understand and value this process.

loans.use: To advance their businesses

loans.name: Asuru A Rehema Adirisi Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Rehema is 27 years old and married with 4 children: 3 girls and 1 boy, all in school. She has been selling charcoal for over 2 years and now. She will use the loan to purchase more charcoal (30 bags) for resale. She is supplying charcoal to schools, community members and other people who come to buy from her. Her dream is to own a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Choukouratou Olanikè

texts.fr:
O.  Choukouratou Olanikè est née le 16/06/1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Choukouratou Olanikè est mariée à AGBOTI Mathias un soudeur de profession. Choukouratou Olanikè est mère d’un enfant âgé de quinze (15) ans et en quatrième année du lycée. Choukouratou Olanikè est dans le secteur de la téléphonie depuis 2007. Choukouratou Olanikè a une cabine téléphonique et vend des services téléphoniques, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, des divers (bombons, biscuits, pâtes dentifrices, détergents, boîtes de laits, etc.) ainsi que des chaussures à  la place publique LENINE de Cotonou. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire croître ses activités Choukouratou Olanikè sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
O. Choukouratou Olanikè was born on June 16, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Choukouratou Olanikè is married to Agboti Mathias, who is a trained welder. She is the mother of a child of 15 who is in the fourth year of the lycée (high school).

Choukouratou Olanikè has been in the telephone sector since 2007. She has a phone booth and sells telephone services, rechargeable phone cards, various small items (candy, cookies, toothpaste, detergent, tins of milk, etc.) as well as shoes, in the Lenin public square in Cotonou. In order to do all she can to respond to the demand from her clientele and grow her business, she is presently requesting her third loan from ALIDé.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of phone use cards, 2 cases of cookies, 5 boxes of candy, and a case of toothpaste

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 7 años ofrece el servicio de toma de fotografías, en especial del tipo de las solicitadas para diferentes trámites administrativos (tamaño carné y pasaporte). Atiende en su puesto todos los días, y algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo, su día de descanso son los domingos. Para llamar la atención de las personas tiene un mostrador de fotos en una calle muy transitada de su ciudad, una vez que consigue un cliente, lo conduce hacia su puesto (cerca de allí para tomarle la foto y luego de unos minutos entregarle la fotografía en la cantidad y tamaño que le haya solicitado. Debido a la calidad de sus  servicios, Janet mantiene ingresos estables, y esto la motiva seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos y en sus funciones como integrante del grupo. El dinero solicita es para la compra de gran cantidad de papel fotográfico.
texts.en:
Janet is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a rented house. For the past 7 years she has offered photography services, especially for administrative type photos (ID or passport sized). She works at her stand every day, and sometimes her husband helps out. She takes Sundays off. To attract customers she has a photo display set up on a busy street in the city. When she gets a customer, she takes him to her stand nearby, takes the photo, and then provides the quantity and size of photos requested a few minutes later. The quality of her work provides Janet with a stable income, and this motivates her to continue investing in her business. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP, and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank. For this reason she promises to be responsible with her payments and in her functions as part of the group. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of a large quantity of photographic paper.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of photography paper

loans.name: Esse

texts.fr: Esse N. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de divers articles au marché de Womé, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. Esse exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce pour mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Esse N., age 35, is married and the mother of 3 children. She resells various items at the market of Womé, a village located in Southwestern Togo. She's been running this business for 3 years, and wishes to use this loan to bolster her business, in order to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.en:
The members of the Familia Unida ('United Family') Communal Bank are involved in various businesses. They are taking out their third loan, and have always been very responsible and punctual in repaying in the past. Their businesses incluD. selling construction materials, legal coca leaves, school materials, beer, cloth for t-shirts, fruit, and other things, plus a food store and teaching brick-laying. They all live in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria area, in a tight-knit community.

Vicky sells salchipapas, a Bolivian meal maD. of sausage and French fries. She would like to buy more potatoes and meat with her loan so she can invest her profits into books and education for her children. She says of them, "As far as I can, I’ll help them. I want them to study and do something in life.”

Juanita has two stores. In one, she sells soft drinks and food, and in the other she sells building materials. She would like a loan to restock products that she needs. Before she had access to capital, she just had a small juice stand. She has two children and says that the loan helps them, especially since one is in college. She wants her children to become professionals and she hopes to enlarge her hardware shop.

Elsa has a flower stand in La Paz. It used to be her mother’s, but Elsa has been running it for five years, ever since her mother passed away. She would like a loan to buy more flowers from Cochabamba (a city about six hours from La Paz) and the Yungas (the rainforest three hours from La Paz) to sell at the stand. Previous loans have allowed her to sell more and Elsa says she now has a higher income and can buy more food for her four boys, three of whom are students. With this loan, she would like to expand her store, with the eventual goal of opening her own flower store downtown, where she could also make and sell flower arrangements and decorations.

Claudia sells clothes and would like a loan as more capital. She has one little daughter, and she says that all she hopes is that her daughter doesn’t lack anything growing up, since “it’s all for her.”

Ruddy is a young man who designs advertisements on his computer for various companies, and sells them to television channels. Ruddy would like to improve his computer. With the profits from his business, he hopes to pay for his studies in computer engineering at the military university. He enjoys the military university a lot for its discipline, and the punctuality and respect it requires. He is looking forward to starting his career when he graduates in five years.

The president, Mrs Maritzabel T., runs her own TV show called "Tropical Rainbow." She is very hardworking and gave a speech telling her group to be responsible.

loans.use: To improve equipment and use as capital

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 48 years old, married, with six children aged between 19 and 29. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she is living with four people. Gladys takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Gladys resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Gladys lives in Naguru, running a little restaurant in Naguru market in one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping as she buys from Owino markert, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

Gladys sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues and rent. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

Gladys has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more food for her little restaurant, such as rice and maize flour for resale. Gladys aspires to see her business grow bigger and own permanent business premises and a home. .

loans.use: To buy more rice, maize flour, and other foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. Rebecca says she works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Rebecca has been in this very business for barely a year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
El señor Isaías L.  ha ido mejorando su casa con ahorros propios, el con  lo poco que gana le va haciendo mejoras a su casa para el bienestar de su familia. Pero ahora el se ve en la necesidad de  construir  una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda. Donde el vive es una avenida muy transitada aunque el puso alrededor tablas, no es tan seguro como una barda de block.
Sus hijos están pequeños y quiere darles lo mejor en protección para evitar un accidente y mas que todo cuando el sale a trabajar a la maquiladora, la seguridad de sus pertenencias que nadie pueda robar.

loans.use: Construccion de barda

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a member of the Idunda borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa. She is 18 year old , she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old.

Jasmin has owned a food business selling bites for 1 year, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jasmin`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jasmin hopes to save more money, pay school,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap Y. is a villager in Kaos Nhai village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Aside from this, she is a breeder who breeds cow, pigs and chicken. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow, three piglets and twenty chickens for her breeding. Her husband, Mr. Soy Sek, is laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sopheap Y. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow, three piglets and twenty chickens for her breeding.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from her plantation, she is a grocer. Mrs. Rom K. is a 49-year-old widow with three children: one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. She lives in Tonle village in TaK. province. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell to earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to resell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita A. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Merlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products like rice, spices and more in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mrs. Samorn M. is a villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In their plantation, she has a problem because their field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Samorn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to pay her child's school fees. Her husband, Mr. Vong Vuthy, is a soldier who has a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Samorn M. is a mother of one child who is studying in VCDs repairer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness is 43 years old and she is married with 5 children. Happiness is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business and family life. She sells plantain and yam at the front of her house. She sells for long hours to provide the food on her table to feed her family.She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Happiness is requesting for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more plantain and yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain and yam  to sell

loans.name: Najjembe Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: Veronica L. is a hard-working and devoted lady with a vibrant business selling fruits and vegetables in the Najjembe market. She has a stall in the main market that is stocked with tomatoes, onions, mangoes, oranges, pineapples and other produce.  She buys fruit and vegetables mostly from farmers in the surrounding villages at a lower price than she pays at the big markets in Kampala and at farm trucks. Veronica is married with 8 children, as she takes care of her siblings in the village. Veronica needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce to resell

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Rosario H. se dedica a vender útiles escolares como lapiceros, agendas, libretas, entre otros siendo ofrecidos ambulantemente en todo el mercado siendo este el trabajo con el que obtiene los ingresos para su hogar.

Es importante destacar que el trabajo ambulante es fatigoso por la exposición al sol y el desgaste de caminar todos los días. Sin embargo, la señora Rosario continua trabajando y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los útiles escolares como lapiceros, agendas y libretas para dar continuidad a la venta de estos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rosario H. sells school supplies in Managua's Mayoreo market. She stocks ball-point pens, agendas and notebooks, among other items. She does not have a stall in the market; she sells by moving throughout the market offering her wares. This is her source of household income. It is important to stress that this ambulatory method of working is exhausting because she is exposed to the sun and the constant walking is very tiring. However, Rosario continues to work and is asking Ceprodel for funding to buy stock items like pens, agendas and notebooks so that she can continue to sell them in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ball-point pens, agendas and notebooks to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia M. is a 46-year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Maitom Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by fishing and operating a fish vending business.

Amalia’s husband, Edelberto, is 49 years old and is a fisherman. They have one adult child. The family dreams of improving their living conditions and sustaining the needs of their family.

Amalia M. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family's income. Now, she earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000 from her business activities.

Amalia M. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her food vending business, and it had a positive impact, on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 16th loan, in the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use on the food vending and carinderia (local eatery) business. Amalia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for food vending and carinderia (local eatery) business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Natalie F. is an industrious, loving woman whose heart is filled with passion to achieve her dreams for her family. Since her husband had a nervous breakdown, Natalie remains strong for her children and by herself, she faces life’s challenges to bring them out of the umbrella of poverty. She really wants her five children, whose age ranges are from one to 11 years old, to graduate from college and have a better kind of life someday. This dream has pushed her to embrace the opportunity of joining ASHI and request a loan, which she will use to start a business.

Hog/pig fattening is the type of business she chose because her children are still small and have to be taken care of as well as her husband. With a hog fattening business, she can perform both her productive and reproductive roles while at home. Profits from this business will be seen after four months of fattening. Someday she wishes that she will be able to have more hogs to raise and sell to have more profit to support her dream, especially for medication for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase hogs for her fattening business.

loans.name: Turargul's Group

texts.en:
“If on your way to success there are not many obstacles, dust, stones, difficulties, that means it will not lead you to your aim.” This statement by a great philosopher from the past has evidence in modern life. Turargul O., a group leader, is a young woman who has felt its truth. From an early age, she knew what poverty was, and will never forget the endless days of struggle against it.
However, it is good to look back on those days from easier circumstances. After a successful marriage, Turargul gave birth to a little princess. Now, this cute creation of God is just two years old. Turargul's husband works as a driver for a hunting firm. About four years ago, Turargul's friends advised her to breed cattle. With her savings of about 15,000 KGS, she started a business. Now she continues with this business and has already bought domestic appliances with the profits. By the time her daughter is older, she wants to be able to give her an education. As her business is flourishing, she is requesting a loan to buy small cattle to resell after fattening.
Venera D. is 26 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom go to kindergarten. Venera has her own shop where she sells daily foodstuffs. Her husband helps her in her business by transporting goods. Venera began her business with 10,000 KGS and now her profit is 8,000 KGS per month. In the near future, she wants to expand the shop by building another structure. With this loan, she will increase her assortment of goods.
Almakul I. is 52 and single. She breeds cattle, and is assisted by her brother. She is requesting a loan to increase the number of cattle.
Gulmira F. is 43 and divorced. She has two daughters – the elder is already married and the youngest attends school. Gulmira sells salads in the market and also works for a firm. With her loan, she wants to buy cattle in order to increase their number. In the future, she wants to buy a flat and give her youngest daughter an education.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy small cattle and resell them after fattening

loans.name: Jose Irnel

texts.en:
Mr. Jose Irnel G. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 41 years old and married with three children. He manages his sari-sari to improve his living situation. He earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from his sari-sari store. He has managed his business for almost two years. Other sources of income come from his farm and his boarding house (rental income).

   He joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. He successfully repaid his previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan is for the expansion of his store. As of now, he has a new loan amounting to 15,000 PHP taken from PMPC. It is the third loan taken from PMPC.

loans.use: Additional capital for his sari-sari store

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Bendugu Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A. primary school, in Bendugu village, in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1955 by the M.C.A. Mission. Currently, the school is staffed with 8 teachers and 395 pupils. This will be the second loan this school is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. The first loan this school accessed from Kiva was in April 2009. That loan made significant improvements in the lives of these borrowers. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would not otherwise be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Kabba K. J. (pictured on the left) is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group of teachers. The 59-year-old man was born in Bendugu village, which is about 60 miles away from Magburaka town.  He is married to a teacher and they have seven children.  Kabba, who has been a teacher for 34 years, is requesting a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc. in order to complete building a five bedroom-and-parlor house he started building with the help of the first Kiva loan he received.   

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house-building materials

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves se caracteriza por ser una mujer aguerrida, de corazón noble y sobretodo responsable. Tiene 42 años, está casada con Pablo de 39 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 10 años.

Mientras atiende a su madre, prepara los alimentos que vende entre sus familiares y amigos, aprovechando que todos laboran en instituciones cumpliendo horarios exigentes que no pueden descuidar. De esta actividad, diariamente percibe 30 soles, a parte de la inversión que realiza en los insumos, mientras su esposo trabaja trasportando a personas en su motocarro, por lo que recibe 45 soles diarios.
Nieves lleva 3 años vendiendo comida de lunes a viernes, pero los fines de semana, vende al público en general, y como le va bien, para más adelante quiere comercializar bebidas heladas, chupetes, gelatinas y pasteles, por lo que ya compró la refrigeradora que le servirá como herramienta de trabajo.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre, está segura de pagar cada cuota puntualmente para continuar siendo el ejemplo de las demás socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una cocina a gas y terminará de pagar la refrigeradora que adquirió hace algunos días.
texts.en:
Nieves is a strong woman, with a noble heart and above all, she is responsible. Nieves is 42, married to Pablo, 39, and together they have a 10-year old son. While she takes care of her mother, she makes food that sells to her relatives and friends, since they work in institutions with fixed hours that they can't miss. From this daily work she nets 30 sols after paying for the ingredients. Her husband works transporting people in his motocar and makes 45 sols every day. Nieves has been selling food Monday to Friday for 3 years, but on the weekends, she sells to the general public. This is going well and in the future she would like to sell frozen drinks, lollipops, jello and cake. Because of this she bought a refrigerator that serves as a work appliance. This is her third loan with MFP and as always, she is sure to make her payment punctually so that she continues being an example to the other members in the communal bank. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy a gas stove and finish paying for the refrigerator that she bought a few days ago.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a gas stove

loans.name: Sailia's Group

texts.en:
Sailia is the wife of S. and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it for over 30 years. A very talented lady, Sailia operates an embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighbors and earns 500 Pak rupees on each dress from them. She completes each dress in two to three days. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He sells fruit in different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart and generates income. He is very hard-working because his selling depends entirely on him going to work and if he misses one day he loses 350 or 450 Pak rupees. Therefore, Sailia is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase the fruit in bulk and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase supplies for candy store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Roberto B., a landscaper, they are blessed with four children. She has been managing her own landscaping business together with her husband for the past few years.

Evelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and paying her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the loans to expand and improve her landscaping business.

To ensure the continued success of her enterprise, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy additional materials and supplies needed for their landscaping projects.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additonal materials and supplies needed for their landscaping projects

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Oscar, tiene 45 años y es natural del Cusco.

Oscar nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica.  Yo y mi esposa Libia nos dedicamos a la venta productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales de las ciudad de Sicuani, Huaso, Cala y Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar los estudios de mis hijos e hice mantenimiento de mi casa. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank "LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA" is presently working its 5th cycle and is set up by hard-working and entrepreneurial individuals who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort give a better future to their children. The meetings of the community bank are every thirty days in the main office of Asociación Arariwa.

Oscar is 45 years old and from Cusco.

Oscar tells us: "We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I and my wife Libia sell products for personal hygiene as well as house accessories at the Saturday and Sunday markets in the towns of Sicuani, Huaso, Cala, and Cusco. For several years I have been working with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well, with the loan and the profits I have been able to pay my children's schooling and maintain my house. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Patachaj Group

texts.es: Doña Paulina, es una persona Casada, curso el segundo  grado de primaria, tiene dos  hijos los cuales Uno de ellos es de  diez años de edad y el otro de cinco años, ella se dedica al Comercio , (Compra  y venta de Ropa Tipica), tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario se  denomina Patachaj, el nombré indica la aldea donde  residen estas personas  y su ubicación. El grupo cuenta con cuatro  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Comercio,   venta de verduras y frutas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería (Ropa Típica) y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Doña paulina es la dueña del negocio, por los que necesitar invertira mas capital, y espera que su negocio sea más grande y competitivo.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and completed the second year of primary school. She has 2 children, one of whom is 10 years old and the other is 5 years old. She has had a business buying and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing for 10 years. With enthusiasm and the help of some neighbors, they organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. This communal bank is called "Patachaj;" the name comes from the town where the members live and where the group meets. This group contains 4 female members, who specialize in different activities, including raising animals, retail trade, and the sale of fruit and vegetables. They will use this loan to buy merchandise (typical clothing) and in this way increase the volume of their sales. Paulina is the owner of the business; she needs to invest more capital, and she hopes that her business will become bigger and more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to buy traditional Guatemalan clothing)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María H. D. L. D. 34 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable con su hogar, ya que a diario sabe dedicarse D. lleno a su trabajo y a su familia y el bienestar D. su casa. Ella vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como profesor, y así mismo vive junto a dos t hijos D. 18 y 10 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a quienes resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Ana trabaja comercializando productos D. belleza como maquillaje, perfumes, joyería, productos para el hogar, carteras y muchos otros artículos más, los cuales son pedidos por catalogo, el cual se dedica a mostrar haciendo visitas D. casa en casa con sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, este tipo D. revista ha venido a ser muy popular entre las personas ya que las vendedoras D. este productos brindan la facilidad D. pagar a crédito a al contado. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral para que D. esta forma ella cuente con el dinero necesario para hacer los pedidos hechos por sus clientes y D. esta forma invertir en el negocio, lo cual se le hace bastante difícil debido a que la mayoría D. sus ventas son a crédito, lo que le dificulta comprar más productos o hacer más pedido. Ana cuenta con mucho optimismo ya que espera realizar todo lo anterior y mejorar su negocio, gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ana María H. D. L. is 34 years old and is a very hard working, woman responsible for her home. She is dedicated to her work and to her family’s well being every day. She lives with her husband, who works as a teacher, and with her two children, ages 18 and 10, who attend school. They all live together in the Ahuachapán department. Ana sells beauty products, such as makeup, perfumes, jewelry, household items, wallets, and many other items through catalogs. She goes door to door to her neighbors, family, and friends to show her products. These types of sales have become very popular because the salespeople make it easy for customers to buy either on credit or in cash. It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan through Integral. She wants to be able to have the money that she needs to process the orders that her customers have placed. She also wants to be able to invest in her business because she finds it difficult to do at this time, since most of her sales are by credit, which itself makes it difficult for her to buy more merchandise or process additional orders. Ana is very optimistic and expects to achieve all of these things and also improve her business, thanks to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of A. D. and lives in the Pakistani city of Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past ten years.
A very talented lady, Shahnaz operates a sewing business from her house. She sews clothes for neighbors and charges them between 100 and 150 PKR for each dress. She can sew two dresses per day. In this way, she can earn between 200 and 300 PKR maximum per day. Her earnings enable her to pay for the utilities.
Shahnaz's husband has a timber sales shop in the nearby market where he sells timber to customers. He has been doing this work for over six years. Both husband and wife are very hardworking. Most of all, they love their work and do it happily. They handle their finances confidently and bravely by helping each other from their businesses.
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy timber in bulk, which will enable him to increase his sales by selling timber to more customers.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia N. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Lydia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per piglet. In 2007, Lydia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase another a mother pig for breeding livestock. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa N. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and a sari-sari (general store). She lives in Sitio To-ong, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and sari-sari store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Teresa is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase fishing materials and more inventory to sell in her general store. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Donabella

texts.en:
Donabella S., age 30, is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. Donabella and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Donabella owns and operates a mini-restaurant, where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Donabella has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

This year, Donabella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Donabella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Donabella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks to sell at the restaurant

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias y también es guía de turismo donde viaja a diferentes lugares guiando a turistas, la socia quiere tener una agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORIWASI” cooperative bank, located in the district of Cusco.  

Her name is Sonia, she is 43 years old, and the single mother of 1 son.  She alternates her daily activities, and is also a tourist guide traveling to different areas to lead tours.  She would like to have a travel agency.  

She is requesting this loan to do some repairs to her home.  She thanks everyone who may take part in this dream of hers via this medium, and commits to repaying the loan in the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela Y. is a married woman who lives in Prk Taraple, Bgry. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a networking  business.  Her husband Jose Y., who is 64 years old, is a retired employee who helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 15 to 27 years old. Estela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Estela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for the future. Estela Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina E. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 32 years old. Rosalina is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 17. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells milk, sugar and other products.

Rosalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracelly Del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio que es salón de belleza, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 9 años, Ella empezó con este negocio, después de que unas amigas le enseñaran este medio de vida que es importante y sus mismas amigas le enviaban clientes para que practicara y se diera a conocer. Después fue ampliando su negocio, ya que ofrecía un buen servicio y los mismos clientes se encargaban de enviarles a otros clientes. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de planchas, peines, talcos entre otras cosas. El sueño que tiene la señora, es ampliar su negocio que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: Aracelly del Carmen has two minor children who she is raising.  She has a business that is a beauty salon, which is located in her home.  She started this business nine years ago.  She started working in this after some friends taught her this way to live that is now so important to her.  Her friends sent her customers to practice on and to get to know.  Afterwards, she began to expand her business as she was offering a good service and her customers took on the task of sending her more customers.  The loan she requested will be invested in buying flat irons, combs, and talcum powder, among other things.  Her dream is to expand her business so that she can offer better economic stability to her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a forty-two-year-old single mother of two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda longing to build her own home in  the next five years. She has a primary school and has also been a farmer for ten years now and the school is enrolling more and more pupils. Her major challenge is the failure of parents to pay promptly. Peluce needs the loan to renovate her school.

loans.use: Renovating the school

loans.name: Selis Jair

texts.es:
Selis tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El es un joven bastante trabajador y emprendedor, con mucho esfuerzo pudo instalar hace mas de dos años un pequeño puesto de venta de alimento balanceado para animales en el mercado de su localidad. El ha estado trabajando arduamente en este negocio y gracia a ello su clientela es estable como también lo son sus ganancias. 

Con las ganancias que ha obtenido de su anterior actividad Selis creyó conveniente incursionar en el negocio de venta de calzado para damas, ya que existen pocos establecimientos de ese tipo en la localidad. El negocio va muy bien y actualmente la demanda se está incrementando debido a la cercanía del verano. Selis desea adquirir más sandalias para ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda que se viene incrementando, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan con el logro de su objetivo.

El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad el pudo ampliar su negocio de venta de alimentos y gracias a esa ayuda este ha podido crecer y de igual manera pudo instalar su puesto de venta de zapatos. Selis se encuentra bastante contento y agradece a las personas que colaboraron con el a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Selis is 19, single and lives with his family in the Cayalti district, an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He is a very hard-working and enterprising youth. With a lot of hard work he was able to open a store for balanced animal food two years ago in the local market. He has worked hard in this business and thanks to his hard work his customer base and income are stable. With the earnings that he has obtained from this business, he decided to venture into selling women's shoes, as there are few such businesses in the area. The business is going very well and the demand is increasing due to the upcoming summer. Selis wants to acquire more sandals to expand his business and satisfy the increasing demand. In order to do so he has needed to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will contribute to the achievement of his goal. He has already had one loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and Capital Semilla. He was able to expand his food business, and thanks to this help his business grew and he was able to open his shoe sales business. Selis is very happy and thankful to the people who are working together through Kiva.

loans.use: To acquire more sandalls to expand his business and satisfy increasing demand

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame N. is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Maame has had senior high school education.  She has been selling provisions in Takoradi for six years. She assists her husband in educating her children. Maame will use this loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one still attends school and one had graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a fruit selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands. During the rainy season, fruit production is low and the business is slow. She hopes to operate a fruit store in the future.

With the  10,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of food and renovate her cafe business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale and renovate cafe business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda T. is from the village of Villaflor Oroq,City. She is 49 years old. Rosalinda married and has 2 adult age children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Moses  Muatha

texts.en:
Moses M. is 57 years old and married to Lonadi, who helps in the farm. He supports six members of his family. He has been in business for one year with an income of KES 5,000 per month. 

This is his first loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy two goats and sheep for fattening, which he will later sell at a profit. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and be a leading livestock trader in the area.

loans.use: To buy two goats and sheep for fattening and selling later at a profit

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 68 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 6 hijos (3 independientes), la señora estudio educación primaria incompleto. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y chanchos.
En la actualidad requerida de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de 3 chanchos y ovejas.  Pascuala trabaja junto con su esposo.  Paralelamente se dedican a la chacra, cosechan papa, habas, cebada, etc.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.	
Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que otorgan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Luján" (Our Lady of Luján) located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno. She is 68 years old, married and the mother of six children (three are independent). She has an incomplete elementary school education.

She has been working with the microfinance institution Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan amounted to 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. She sells groceries and pigs. Currently she applies for a new loan of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use the money to buy three pigs and sheep. Pascuala works with her husband. They are also working at their farm, harvesting potatoes, beans, barley, etc.

Her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the easiness of their loan granting procedure.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs and sheep

loans.name: Isabel Maricela

texts.es: La Señora Isabel Maricela tiene 59 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que no dependen de ella. Ella se dedica a una pulpería. Sus inicios se dan porque necesitaba un trabajo  y por la edad que tiene no ha podido conseguir un trabajo, por lo que decidió establecer este medio de vida en su vivienda. La mayoría de sus vecinos, amigos y familiares llegan a solicitarle diferentes productos a su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es surtir más su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en: Isabel Maricela is 59 years old, she is married and she has 2 grown children who no longer depend on her. She has a grocery store business. She started out because she needed work and given her age she was not able to find employment. So she decided to set up this business in her house. The majority of her neighbors, friends, and family come to request various products from her business. The loan will be used to purchase sweets, juices, soft drinks, detergents, and basic grains. Her wish is to add variety to her business and to provide a better service to each one of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, juices, soft drinks, detergents, and basic grains

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children.

In 2007, Shaker opened a block factory. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator. He aspires to develop his work and to earn more income to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married. She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Norte. She works with her husband on their farm and grows rice. This has been her business for a long time now. The income generated has been her source of livelihood since her children were young. Elena also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Elena's loan will be used to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 23 años, es soltera vive con la madre y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papas, trigo, cebada, maíz tiene 4 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir casa.

Le gusta leer libros, escuchar música.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and her children in the settlement of Guaranda, in Bolívar province. She has 3 children.

The members of the communal bank "Nucanchi Kawsay Group" live in El Rayo community, in the parish of Guanujo in Guaranda, 25 minutes away from the Co-operative's office. The group members dedicate their time to a range of activities that include: arable farming, cattle raising, business, raising livestock, bricklaying and running a sawmill. 

María works in agriculture, sowing potatoes, wheat, barley, and maize. She also has 4 head of cattle. She buys what she needs in the market in Guaranda and sells her produce in the largest market in the same city.

She is seeking the loan to buy raw materials and feed for her animals. The credit will help her financially to meet her essential costs, and to overcome any challenges such as crop infestations, illness, and the uncertain climate. Her dream is to build a house. 

She likes to read books and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and animal feed

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 52 años y sus 2 queridas hijas menores Geraldine de 16 y Sharon de 9 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su propia casa Zoila tiene un puesto de comida donde vende sus deliciosos platillos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general vende mucho durante toda la noche. Tiene 32 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuosa con las demás socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar más comida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 49 years old.  She is a very kind and simple woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 52 year-old Jorge, and her two beloved daughters, 16 year-old Geraldine and 9 year-old Sharon, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

In her own home, Zoila has a sales location where she sells her delicious dishes.  The wonderful smell that comes from her delicious stews is enough to attract her customers.  Her business is very busy and, in general, she sells a lot of meals all evening long.  Zoila has been in this business for 32 years and it has made her the money she needs to feed her daughters and pay for their education.  However, she feels that, in the future, she will have more expenses and she will not have enough money to cover them.  For this reason, she would like to set up a restaurant where she can sell her tasty meals more comfortably and thereby improve her income.  Zoila enjoys chatting to her customers and has fun doing so but it is very difficult serving all the people who come to her business.  However, she does not falter in her desire to get ahead in life and she is prepared to work hard in order to achieve this.

This will be Zoila's seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to make her repayments on time so as not to cause problems for her community bank where she is very respectful towards the other members.  Zoila will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more ingredients so that she can prepare more meals.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making meals

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 4 children.

Sarah has a game shop with coin-operated game machines. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay the utilities needed to maintain her operations.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda  is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Elda  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & breads. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to resell.

Elda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Mounira

texts.fr:
Mounira est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a  03 enfants.
Mounira est revendeuse de céréales depuis 2001. Elle vend  au marché de N’kafu. Elle achète les produits à l’intérieur du pays. 
Mounira a requis son premier cycle crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en: Mounira is a 28 year old woman.  She is married to a chauffeur.  She has three children.  Mounira has been re-selling fertilizers since 2001.  She sells at the N'kafu market.  She buys her products inside the country.  Mounira has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Fawzeya

texts.en:
Fawzeya is a 46-year-old woman; she is married and has four sons and two daughters. Two of her sons are employed: one of them is a teacher the other is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Her husband is a taxi driver whose taxi needs to be repaired and have its license renewed. The taxi's income is not enough to pay for these things, therefore Fawzeya took out a loan of $1,500 from FATEN that is to be repaid on a monthly basis. 

Fawzeya is a religious woman, therefore her son is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for taxi repair and licensing fees

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus hijos de 3, 6 y 8 años de edad, ella trabaja todos los días haciendo tortillas para vender, en ocasiones también vende meriendas a los clientes.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz y leña, para la preparación de las tortillas, con estos materiales podrá disponer para aumentar la producción o simplemente suplir la demanda.
Ella trabaja para mantener a sus hijos, le preocupa el no tener materia prima para elaborar las tortillas, por lo mismo espera que después de este financiamiento su negocio marche mejor.
texts.en:
Margarita lives with her children, ages 3, 6 and 8.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living, working every day, and sometimes prepares "meriendas" (afternoon snacks) for customers.

She is in need of a loan to buy corn and firewood so she can meet demand or increase tortilla production.  She works to support her children and is concerned about not having the raw materials for her tortillas.  After receiving this loan, hopefully her business will get better.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

Janice has been selling barbequed food for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase housing materials (cement, plywood, etc.) needed to repair her house. Janice has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials to repair her house

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Aiyda

texts.en: Aiyda is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Aiyda wants to improve her family life conditions by purchasing new home furniture, but the amount of money Aiyda has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN of $1,500. When Aiyda gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and live with her family in healthy, comfortable home conditions. Aiyda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has seven years of experience working as a hairdresser. She started running her own business seven years ago.
