The role of being a father for 27 years has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He grows potatoes, onions, carrots, and other kinds of vegetables in his garden. Parmonkul dreams of making it possible for all of his children to be well educated and to ensure them with bright futures. That’s why he works from early morning till late at night. He wants to borrow a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) for the term of 9 months so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Parmonkul is asking for help from your generous heart. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Patricia Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Lourdes C. R.,  tiene 30 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo en Sullana durante 1 año, carrera que no ejerció porque se vino a vivir a Trujillo, tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina, se inicio en el negocio vendiendo productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo empezó la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina, el mismo que le da mas ganancias, su  negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Patricia es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de algarrobina y miel de abeja para la venta.
Patricia sueña tener una distribuidora de miel de abeja y algarrobina
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche se su sector.
texts.en:
Patricia Lourdes C. R. is 30 years old and lives in La Rinconada, in the district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied to be an executive assistant in Sullana for a year, a career she never pursued as she came to live in Trujillo. She has two small children who are completely dependent upon her. She sells honey and syrup of algarrobo (algarrobo is a tree). She started her business by selling beauty products. With the profits she made, she began selling honey and syrup of algarrobo which she can make higher profits from. She runs her business from her home. Patricia is a new member of the community bank "Mujeres Decididas II". With this 300 soles loan which she will repay over four months, she will buy syrup of algarrobo and honey for resale. Patricia dreams of being a distributor of honey and syrup of algarrobo. She is a member of her local "Vaso de Leche" programme, a programme to distribute milk, milk products, cereals and so on to low-income households.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy syrup of algarrobo and honey for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima M. A. has run a business for three years selling a variety of fruits at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children.

She purchases fruit from the Buguruni city fruit market center and sells to customers at retail in Vituka. The fruit Halima sells includes paw paws, mangoes, oranges, avocados, bananas, and watermelon. She also sells a variety of green vegetables. Halima is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to help build up her business.

loans.use: Build up the business

loans.name: Sylvester's Group

texts.en:
Sylvester M. is one of the executive members of Semuti group in Mityana. He is a Chief at his Sub County where he collects taxes and revenue from markets and shops and gives out licenses.

Sylvester also has a retail shop in the Semuti trading center as his business, so whenever he is out of work, he goes to it to help out his wife. He needs a loan to help with restocking his shop with more goods that can bring in more revenue.

loans.use: Buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Felictus Kwagala‘S Group

texts.en:
Felictus is 60 years of age, widowed, and the mother of 4 children aged between 22 and 40 years old. All of her children have finished school. She rents a one room house, where she lives with seven people and doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity and piped water at home.

The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea. Felictus sells vegetables in Kasubi market, one of the city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She buys from delivery trucks at her place of work and doesn’t incur any additional transport costs. Felictus receives about 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Felictus works seven days a week and rents her business premises. She has done this business for ten years now and is faced with the challenge of seasonality (when customers can’t come in any day or time) and the place she operates from gets flooded and muddy when it rains.  This is her 7th loan since she joined MCDT and she has been with MCDT for 3 1/2 years, and has always worked with the same group mates. Felictus wants to use this loan to buy more vegetables. She aspires to start selling matooke (bananas).

loans.use: To buy more boxes of vegetables

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana sells provisions to her customers. She started this business five years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.

Juliana is 42 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita V. is 60 years old. She is still selling wine to support her self as well as her two children who are already married. She wants to grow her business even more. She needs additional capital to be able to display more tuba (palm wine) in her house. Tuba is a type of wine that is produced from coconut plants. People in her village know her very well for her tuba business. She would like a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional tuba wine to sell.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI gives credit assistance as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional "tuba" (palm wine)

loans.name: Huracan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Huracán” esta conformado por 4 hombres y 11 mujeres  a la cabeza D. su presidenta la señora Griselda y las señoras Mercedes y Martha que son la tesorera y secretaria del grupo,  este banco se caracteriza por ser uno D. los mejores ya que demostraron ser responsables y siguen creciendo juntos es así que cada una D. ellas va invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. comida, cosméticos por catalogo , ropa y sus actividades D. elaboración D. pan, transporte público, servicio D. peluquería y constructores D. vivienda. El crédito que solicitaron fue para  la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. sus productos así como la adquisición D. materiales y herramientas que hagan mas eficiente sus actividades generando mayores ingreso que ayuD. a mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias y ser mas competitivos en el mercado
texts.en:
The group “Huracán” [“Hurricane”] is comprised of 4 men and 11 women. At the head of their organization is the president, Griselda, the treasurer, Mercedes, and the secretary, Martha. This bank is characterized by being one of the best since they demonstrated they are responsible and continue to grow. It’s in this way that each one of them invests in their small businesses of selling food, cosmetics through catalogs, and clothes and their activities of making bread, public transportation, hairdressing services, and homebuilding. The credit that they requested was for buying raw materials to make their products, such as the acquisition of materials and tools that make their activities more efficient and help generate greater profits. This helps to improve the quality of life of their families and makes their businesses more competitive in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en: Taiba is 30 years old and married with 4 children.She sells cooked foods and she loves this business. She hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel R. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace mucho tiempo ha tenido el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello, en este momento ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así llevar a cabo su obra.

Por esta razón ella espera que su crédito le será otorgado sin ningún problema y así mejorará sus condiciones de vida y las de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel R. is a hard-working lady who has had a long time dream of improving her home conditions. She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials. For this reason she hopes that her loan will be granted without any problem and this way to improve the living conditions of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Мархабо

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мархабо женщина 31 года , которая третий год кредитуется в наше организации. Она проживает в Костакозе и занимается вместе с мужем уходом за скотом.  Кроме этого Мархабо работает в колхозе , но вместо денег её дают продукты питания.  Она  пунктуально работает с организацией. Планирует купить корм для коров и ещё пару молодых бычков.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 37-year-old mother of three who lives in, and runs her welding business in, Mihang’o, Nairobi. She is asking for her first loan of Ksh 50,000 in order to add to her stock of metal. She hopes to one day own a hardware store. She describes herself as hardworking, jovial, and as one with good character. She hopes to educate her children to the highest level.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of metal

loans.name: Siupolu

texts.en:
Siupolu P. is a 34 year-year-old woman who lives in the town of Leloto-Leauvaa. She is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Siupolu owns and operates an agricultural business raising crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling fruits and vegetables. Siupolu has been in this business for over four years, and she earns approximately 156 Samoan Tala WST a month.

In 2009, Siupolu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. Siupolu's first loan request from SPBD is for 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. Siupolu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
A. Abdugaffor is 48 years old. Together with his wife they’ve raised 4 children. Abdugaffor is running the drug store already for 4 years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town which allows him to have many clients and customers. Now he requests 3000 Somoni. Being very accurate person by his nature Abdugaffor is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that he is able to pay the loan in time without any violations. Your generosity can change his family living standard.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny P. is 47 years old and she lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Neang Ngouk, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Ny P. is requesting a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living. This couple has a child who is laborer. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 37 years old and is married with four children aged between 13 and 16 years. She also takes care of two dependents from another family. Sara lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Since 2004, Sarah has owned a small shop selling various styles of clothes for men and women. This is her fifth year of successful operation in her business! The hours of her shop are from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Sarah is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors.

With this loan, Sara hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profit in the process. This, in turn will allow her and her devoted husband to buy a house they have long dreamed of owning. Also, it will allow her to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for her family and dependents.

loans.use: To buy more variety and sizes of clothing

loans.name: Pach

texts.en:
Mrs. Pach S. was born in 1965 and lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo province. Cambodia. She is Khmer noodle seller. Her husband, Mr. Tom Sarath, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing 625 more ducklings for breeding to earn more income. Mrs. Pach S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

This couple has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a duck breeder, one is a laborer, and the other one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy 625 ducklings

loans.name: Michael Ombaka

texts.en:
Michael O., 25 years old, is a barber. His wife is named Roselyda Makoha. Michael has owned a barber shop for the last two years and generates a monthly profit of about Ksh. 10,000.

To supplement his income from the barber shop, O. has a side business: he operates a cafeteria in Shanzu. He was introduced to KADET by existing clients who encouraged him to apply for a loan. He would like to see his cafeteria business grow and he believes that this loan will boost his endeavors in the right direction.

In the future, he wants to be a commercial horticultural farmer while also running his cafeteria business and continuing to work as a barber.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to empower its clients economically by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET at www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To boost his cafeteria business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old man living with his mother and 2 unemployed sisters. He is the only provider for the family; he works as a computer programmer and maintainer since 2008 upon client’s request. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a car that will facilitate his transportation and he will be able to satisfy the demands of his clients immediately.

loans.use: Buy a car

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.pt:
Carlos Ernesto N. nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Província do Mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 6, 7, 9 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 3ª classe não continuou porque perdeu os pais e não tinha ninguém que podia sustentar os seus estudos. Vive na casa dos serviços com sua família e ainda sustenta seus irmãos enviando dinheiro para o pagamento de energia e água.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane para fixar uma nova residência com a sua família depois de ter conseguido um novo talhão. Trabalha como motorista na ferragem raia em Boane a mais de 8 anos e faz em media cerca de 10 horas por dia, e tem um salário mensal de 6.799.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, ferro e areia) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.500.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Carlos Ernesto N. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of 4 children who are 6, 7, 9, and 11 years old. All go to school. He only studied through the 3rd grade because his parents died and he didn't have anybody who could support his studies. He lives in the service workers houses with his family and even supports his brothers and sisters by sending money for the power and water bills. He left Maputo for Boane in order to set up a new home with his family after he found a new job. He has worked as a driver in the outlying ironworks sector for more than 10 years and works on average around 10 hours each day. He receives a monthly salary of 6,799 MZN that he uses for household expenses. He even saves some in his bank account. He has never had loans through banks. He found out about Hluvuku through service colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 8,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction materials (beams, panes, cement, steel, and sand) in order to continue with the construction of his house. The previous loan was for 5,500 MZN, for the same purpose. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to continue to build his house and to start a commercial business.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, steel, etc.)

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace cuatro años adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Empezó alquilándola a un chofer particular y luego con el tiempo pudo adquirir otra unidad que también alquila para su respectivo trabajo. 

El tiempo de uso que se le ha otorgado a su primera mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir fallas en el motor y que necesite de reparación urgente, María no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas reparaciones, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María es una madre responsable y que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder comprarse otra unidad.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 and lives with her husband and her two children in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. It has been four years since she acquired a mototaxi (a motor vehicle for transporting cargo and passengers) with money that she saved. She began to rent the car to a chauffeur and, with time, she was able to acquire a second car that she also rented out for business. Usage over time caused the taxi to suffer motor failure and it now requires urgent repair. Maria does not have enough capital to afford these repairs and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is a responsible mother and is always finding ways to help her family get ahead. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to buy another car for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenditures for repairs and maintenance of mototaxis

loans.name: Yanis

texts.es: El Sr. Yanis P. trabaja en Cemex cementera (elaboración del cemento) ubicada aquí en el municipio de san Rafael del sur es operador de hornos tiene 20 años para trabajar a esta institución. Ya ha tenido 8 créditos con Ceprodel lo cual me ha  impactado muchísimo porque ha sido una gran ayuda para mi poder mejorar mi casita y comprar electrodomésticos para mi esposa, también he  podido ayudarme en  los estudio de mi hija que está en la universidad. Estoy casado tengo una familia de 3 hijos uno en la universidad y uno en primaria, mi esposa es ama de casa.
texts.en:
Señor Yanis P. works in the Cemex cement plant (manufacturing cement) located here in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He has been working at this institution for 20 years operating the ovens. He has already had 8 loans through Ceprodel that "have had a big impact on me by helping me improve my house and buy electric appliances for my wife. They have also helped my daughter to study at the university. I am married with 3 children, one at university and one in primary school. My wife is the soul of our home."

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Akayévi

texts.en:
Akayévi A. is 27 years old, is single, and does not have children. She works selling pre-paid cellphone cards in Lomé, Togo. She is the sole employee of her business which she began in 2005.

Ms. A. is now asking for her second loan from WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock of cellphone cards.

loans.use: To purchase more pre-paid cellphone cards

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
R. Sharifa is 49 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married and has three children.

This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for kids: jackets, sweaters, jeans and so on. Sharifa started her business thirteen years ago. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and, thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Sharifa needs a loan of $1100 which she will use to buy clothing for the spring season to meet the demands of her clients and to continue growing her business. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve this family's quality of life.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spring clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Suipacha Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento SUIPACHA es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución hace 3 ciclos, la mayoria D. sus participantes son comerciantes D. diferentes productos.

El Sr. ROLANDO tiene a su cargo la presidencia, se dedica a la venta y compra D. muebles en las diferentes zonas D. la ciudad D. La Paz y El Alto, tiene una familia numerosa y con el prestamo a conseguido comprar muebles en oferta, con este negocio tiene pensado ahorrar para los estudios D. sus hijos.

La Sra. EVELIN es una nueva participante  y ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, ella se constituye en jefe D. hogar, ya que actualmente se encuentra separada, con el prestamo a podido viajar a la localidad del Desaguadero a traer tennis por cantidad y a menor precio, con sus ingresos piensa aumentar su capital.
 
La Sra. LIZET tiene una familia D. 4 miembros, ella trabaja en una fabrica D. costura, pero como tiene hijos pequeños tiene pensado retirarse y con el prestamo tiene planes D. instalar una tienda por su casa y D. esta forma estar más cerca D. su familia y generando ingresos.


Todas las socias son personas responsbles, dinamicas y trabajadoras que tienen que trabajar duro y sacar a sus familias adelante y asi poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
						
						

OJO: En la foto se encuentran 11 personas ya que una D. las socias fue acompañada por sus hijas.
texts.en:
The Banco D. Emprendimiento SUIPACHA (Entrepreneurship Bank SUIPACHA) is a bank that has been working with our institution for 3 cycles. The majority of their participants have businesses selling various products. Rolando is the president. He buys and sells furniture in different areas of La Paz and El Alto. He has a large family. With the loan he will be able to purchase furniture on sale. He hopes to use this business to save for his children’s education. Evelin is a new member and she is secretary of the group. She is the head of her household, as she is separated. With this loan she is able to travel to Desaguadero to purchase tennis shoes in bulk and at a lower price. With her income she plans to increase her working capital. Lizet has a family of four. She works in a factory making clothes, but since she has small children, she is planning to resign and use the loan to set up a store in her home. That way she can be closer to her family and generate income. All of the members are responsible, dynamic, and hardworking. They have to work hard to get their families ahead and thus be able to improve their families' quality of life. They are thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them with this loan. Note: In the photo there are 11 people, because one of the members is accompanied by her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lidia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lidia del Socorro C. V., tiene 37 años vive, en el Barrio Laureles sur es casada y su marido trabaja como jardinero, apoyándole económicamente a los gastos mensuales del hogar, ella labora como afanadora en un centro de salud, su situación económica es bastante precaria, pero dentro de sus mayores aspiraciones esta la culminación estructural de su vivienda, es para esto que solicita de un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción, para la edificación de una pared lateral, que le divida su terreno con la de su vecino y le brinde una mayor seguridad a su hijo, que cual actualmente está en una etapa de su vida en donde las males influencias pueden ocasionar malos caminos sociales, este apoyo les ayudara en gran medida a la familia, fortificando su hogar y brindándole mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia del Socorro C. V. is 37 years old, she lives in Barrio Laureles sur, is married and her husband works as a gardener and supports her economically with the monthly family expenses. She works as a helper at a health center. Her economical situation is very poor, but one of her most important aspirations is to finish building her house and therefore she requests a loan to buy building material to build a side wall to divide her land from that of her neighbor giving more security for her son who is at the time of his life when bad influences can cause taking the wrong social path. This support will help the family a lot, making their home stronger and offering better economical conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a side wall

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la señora Karla Patricia M. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Karla se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y cosmeticos, tiene 4 años con su negocio, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria y productos como ser:
cremas, sandalias, pan, galletas, refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijoles, harina de maiz y trigo, huevos, mantequilla, quesos, churros, jabones, papel higienico, candelas, pastillas, sopas, sal, condimentos..
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio cada dia esta creciendo un poco mas. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Patricia M. is 29, single, and has two children. Karla has been selling groceries and cosmetics for the past 4 years in a business in her house. She will use the loan to buy groceries and products such as: creams, sandals, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, corn meal and flour, eggs, butter, bread, churros (fried crullers), soaps, toilet paper, candles, pills, soups, salt and condiments. She tells us that she feels very happy since her business is growing a little more every day. She needs the profits to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: creams, sandals, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, corn meal and flour, eggs, butter, bread, churros (fried crullers), soaps, toilet paper, candles, pills, soups, salt and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Valeria es viuda, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Valeria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatos, zapatillas, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Valeria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
El sueño de Valeria es tener un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Valeria, 51, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She is a widow and has 4 children. Valeria has a stall in the 12 de Abril market where she sells shoes and sandals that she gets in the city of Lima. Valeria needs a 3000 sol loan to buy shoes. Her dream is to own a lot on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. B., aged 30, operates his own small business planting various crops. He harvests and sells the crops to buyers when they come to maturity. B. has a life partner in his wife (who appears in the photo above) who assists him in growing the crops. The couple helps each other in order to feed their young child, who is enrolled in school. As he hopes for a good result in this cultivation season, B. is applying for assistance on Kiva to grow potato crops. He is hopeful that the loan will provide good benefits that will enable him to meet his family’s financial crisis and pay his loan installments.

loans.use: To grow potato crops

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi O. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Noemi is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Noemi owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Noemi has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noemi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noemi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Noemi is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noemi from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Ellas son "Pensamientos" un grupo conformado por 17 mujeres las cuales luchan diariamente por salir adelante y darle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco en el Estado de México. Los integrantes del grupo son: Lourdes P. P. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), Mirna Socorro González C. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), María del Socorro R. S. (Refaccionaria), Reyna S. C. (Industria Bordadora), Norma Zenón M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), Maricela C. Ramírez (Venta de Música), Paulina Ramírez González (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), María D. C. (Florería), Raquel O. S. (Estética) María de Lourdes O. S. (Venta de Postres), María del Roció C. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), Concepción González C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), Roselía García C. (Venta de Música), María Esther Pérez H. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), Rosa María Martha V. J. (Materiales para Construcción) y Sara Zenón M. (Venta de Ropa Interior por Catalogo)   

Reyna S. C., es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son casados. Ella trabajaba de afanadora pero cuando enfermo de osteoporosis tuvo que dejar su trabajo ya que esta enfermedad afecto sus piernas así que decidió dedicarse a otro tipo de actividad. Hace 15 años comenzó con la elaboración de prendas tejidas a mano como: blusas, chalecos, bufandas, suéteres, chambritas, etc. Al principio fue difícil para ella pero con el tiempo y la práctica continua se le ha hecho más fácil, actualmente compra revistas para hacer prendas más modernas y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de hilos, ganchos, botones, cierres, etc. Reyna siempre que sale lleva consigo una prenda de muestra y aparte lleva material para ir haciendo durante el camino, su mercancía la ofrece con sus vecinos y familiares. Sus épocas de mayor venta son en las fechas especiales como cumpleaños y en épocas de frio. Con las ganancias desea apoyar a su hija que también tiene osteoporosis, a su hija le avanzó más rápido que a Reyna y desea apoyar a su hija con las terapias para que pueda volver a caminar. Los planes de Reyna son poder poner un local propio y así tener sus blusas y chalecos en exhibición para que la gente conozca el trabajo que hace y tener mayor venta.

 Ella junto con las demás integrantes agradece el apoyo que les brinda Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Pensamientos" ("Thoughts"), and it is made up of 17 women who are working hard every day to get ahead and provide a better future for their families. They are located in the Chalco Valley, in the State of México. The members of the group are: Lourdes P. P. (cosmetics sales by catalog), Mirna Socorro González C. (cosmetics sales by catalog), María del Socorro R. S. (auto parts sales), Reyna S. C. (machine embroidery), Norma Zenón M. (fruit and vegetable sales), Maricela C. Ramírez (music sales), Paulina Ramírez González (shoe sales by catalog), María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (cosmetics sales by catalog), María D. C. (flower sales), Raquel O. S. (beauty shop), María de Lourdes O. S. (desserts), María del Roció C. M. (fruit and vegetable sales), Concepción González C. (shoe sales by catalog), Rose lía García C. (music sales), María Esther Pérez H. (shoe sales by catalog), Rosa María Martha V. J. (construction materials), and Sara Zenón M. (lingerie sales by catalog). Reyna S. is a single mother with three children, who are already grown and married. She used to work as a cleaning lady, but when she began suffering from osteoporosis, she had to leave her job, since the condition affected her legs. She decided to dedicate herself to another kind of work, so 15 years ago, she began making hand-knitted garments such as blouses, jackets, scarves, sweaters, baby clothes, etc. At the beginning, it was hard for her, but with time and continuous practice, it became easier. At present, she buys magazines to make more modern clothing designs and satisfy her customers' needs. She will use the funds from the loan she is requesting to buy yarn, hook closures, buttons, zippers, etc. Whenever she goes out, Reyna takes a sample garment and also carries supplies to keep working during the journey. She offers her merchandise to her family members and neighbors. She makes the most sales for special days such as birthdays, and during the cold months. With her earnings, she wants to support her daughter with her therapy so that she will be able to walk again, since her daughter also has osteoporosis which is advancing very rapidly. In the future, Reyna plans to open her own store and put her blouses and jackets on display, so that people will get to know her work and she will increase her sales. Reyna and the other members are grateful for the support provided to them by Kiva through the Realidad Foundation, which will help them achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying yarn, hook closures, buttons, zippers, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita L. is from Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 61 years old and is married with six adult children. Warlita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Warlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor O., 63, is married and lives with three of her children in Takeo province. Working a farm together with her husband, Sor O. typically makes US$1.50 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in garment factories and one child who is a professional silk weaver.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sor O. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of U.S. $1,200 to purchase more raw silk for weaving. (Sor O. and her husband were not available for picture so her daughter, whose work is weaving silk, is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
This is Consorcia V., 51, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fortunato V.. They are blessed with good health and strong physiques which enable them to work hard for their family.

Consorcia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy shampoo, cooking oil, or eggs. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Consorcia dreams to be able to enjoy her simple life together with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly P. is a 43-year-old married woman who was selected as the leader for this group loan, which consists of four people located in Anlong Ta Sek Kraom village, Kandal province. 

Ly P. and her husband, Mr. Ngy Oeun, who is 44 years old, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate string beans and rice for a living. Beside being farmers, they are also cow middlemen who are able to earn a small income this way to improve their family. For their cow business, Ly P. will use the funding through AMK to add to her savings to buy more cows to sell. 

This couple has four children who are students and who also help support their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Choijid

texts.en: Choijid B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own ger, a traditional housing tent, in Uvs province, Mongolia.  Both his children are students, currently working and studying in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife operates a clothes making business in their home, by sewing a variety of traditional clothes according to customers' orders. Choijid has been operating a car repair center for the past 7 years and has since built a stable operation. His monthly revenue is around 150,000 MNT. He has purchased 8,000 bricks and is planning to build a garage that will be used as a workplace. Choijid is a modest man and says, "I hope to establish my own car repair center with my son when he returns home after completing his undergraduate degree next year." He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to build his own workplace.

loans.use: to build his own workplace

loans.name: Divina Misericordia 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Quelsi is the coordinator of her group Divina Misericordia 3 & 4, (Divine Mercy). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She said her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house. Quelsi is excited about her fourth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately two years, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying vegetables and fruits. She will use the profits to buy a freezer and build a bathroom for her house. She hopes to see her children become professionals.

This Esperanza associate story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production.  Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beer, soda and mineral water to resell

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her daughter, age 7, attends a local elementary school.

She and her husband operate a consumer goods retail business out of two different places in their town. They started their business in 2002 by operating a meat trading business between 2002 and 2003 after moving to their current town. Since 2004 they have been selling a variety of products that have been imported from China.

In the future, Chuluuntsetseg plans to expand her business by opening a branch shop and having their own work place. She is a talkative and open minded woman and says, "My dream is to have my own apartment where my family can live." She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her consumer goods trading business.

loans.use: To buy more consumer goods.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 61 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.30, la liba de azúcar $ 0.35. Vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil una de las zonas caracterizada por que la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.
 
Empezó hace 10 años vendiendo helados y confites poco a poco creció su negocio con algunos ahorros que tenía. Compro unas vitrinas, arroz, enlatados, azúcar para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. Poco a poco su tienda fue conocida hasta ahora que trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 23h00pm con la ayuda de su hija mayor. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar dulces, aceite, arroz para surtir más su tienda. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Carlos, 61, has a grocery store where he sells a pound of rice for $0.30, a pound of sugar for $0.35.  He lives in El Suburbio de Guayaquil one of the areas that’s notable because most of its residents are merchants.

He started ten years ago selling ice cream and snacks.  The business grew gradually thanks to some savings he had.  He bought some display cases, rice, canned goods and sugar so that her customers would have more variety to buy.  Little by little the store became well known and how he’s open from 6:30am until 11pm.  His eldest daughter helps him.

He will use the loan to buy candy, cooking oil and rice to better stock his store.  In the future he’d like to expand the business and buy more merchandise.

loans.use: For candy, cooking oil, rice.

loans.name: Susan Nyambura

texts.en:
Susan is 34 years and is married to Dominic G., who also contributes to their family income. They have three children and she has been running her retail shop for a period of one year with a profit of about Kshs. 9,000 per month.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous ones. She plans to use the loan to add more stock of dry goods like flour, rice and sugar. She hopes to be a leading wholesale trader, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Mrs. Bun Sokhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 14 people who are living in Prasat village in the Takeo province. Mrs. B. S. is a village-bank president who has been selected by the other members, all of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their families' living conditions. 

She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also sells brooms at the local market. Since both businesses are going well, she wants to expand. So to increase her daily income, Mrs. B. S. is requesting a loan to buy more brooms, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to buy rice seeds. 

She is a widow with two children. One of her children is a student, but the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy more brooms

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia, hoy sus 9 hijos son personas mayores e independientes en sus propios hogares y con mas razón  trabaja con toda la energía al lado de su esposa. En épocas de siembra trabajan con la ayuda de 2 toros que posee,  útiles para el arado de la tierra, de esta manera logra las cosechas satisfactorias para ser vendidas en el mercado de su zona. Sus tierras de cultivo se ubican en una buena zona y con canales de riego que garantizan una buena cosecha por lo que  Félix continuará trabajando  en la agricultura. Es su crédito número 16  con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono  para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Félix is 57 years old and lives with his wife in their own house.  He has spent his entire life working in agriculture, which has made it possible for him to support his family.  Today, his nine children are independent adults with their own homes, so now he works harder than ever alongside his wife.  During the planting season, they work with the help of their two bulls, which are useful for plowing their fields.  This helps them achieve satisfactory harvests that they can sell in the markets in their region.  Their fields are located in a good area with irrigation canals that guarantee a good harvest that will keep Félix in the farming business.

This is his 16th loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has this financial support.  He has always shown himself to be responsible with his repayments, and he is also grateful to be part of his communal bank because all of its members are responsible and group-minded people.  He thanks all of the people who will be providing him with this loan because it will be very useful in his efforts to make progress with his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for planting corn.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es: El Sr. Brigido B. N. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal Carazo desempeñándose como Jefe de Filial tiene  cinco   años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Brigido B. N. has been working as a branch manager for Enacal Carazo for 5 years.  He is married and has one school-age child.

Brigido has had two loans from Ceprodel and each one has been used to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. to extend and improve his home.  The loans from Ceprodel have been very useful to him since they have enabled him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks and wood

loans.name: Lady-Lyn

texts.en:
Lady-lyn F. is from the village of Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 21 years old. Lady-lyn is single. To make a living, Lady-lyn owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing party services to local community members. She provides chairs and tables and video oke for rent. Lady-lyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lady-lyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lady-lyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional chairs and tables for better rental services. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lady-lyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional chairs and tables to provide better service

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana P. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 61 years old. Ponciana is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing sewing services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ponciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ponciana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jose De Mercedes

texts.es:
El señor Jose de Mercedes B., es de la Compañia Tava´i, es casado y tiene casa propia.
El señor es propietario de una despensa bien surtida en su propio domicilio, empezó con una pequeña casilla vendiendo empanadas, milanesas (carne frita) y bebidas en general, y siempre soñaba en tener una despensa como la que tiene ahora, gracias a su honestidad y a su responsabilidad que le caracteriza.
También se dedica a la agricultura, tiene buen ingreso mensual y posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Su sueño es tener un local comercial más grande para cargar más su negocio y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Por eso solicita este crédito, para compra de mercaderías (panificados, carnes, bebidas, legumbres, frutas, verduras, golosinas, etc.)
texts.en:
Jose de Mercedes B. is from Compañia Tava´i.  He is married and owns his own home. 

He owns a well-stocked grocery store that is located in his home.  He started with a small space selling empanadas, milanesas (fried meat), and drinks.  He always dreamed of having a store like he has now thanks to his characteristics of honesty and responsibility.

He also works as a farmer.  He has a good income every month and he has good personal and business references.

His dream is to have a larger store to expand his business and meet the needs of his customers.  He is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for the store, for example, breads, meat, drinks, legumes, fruits, vegetables, sweets, and more.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (bread, meat, drinks, legumes, fruit, vegetables, sweets, etc.)

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel, de 25 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobresalir en la vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Abel, son el principal sustento que tiene, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar lo sembrado son de buena calidad, eso le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar sus plantas. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, choclo y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder aumentar su producción. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Abel is 25 years old and a very modest and hard-working person. He lives in his parents' home and is prepared to work very hard to move up in life. He put in a lot of effort to obtain fields of crops in order to make a living, and his products are in high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma since they gained fame for their high quality, which allows him to sell the products at very good prices. What he likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests that could harm them. He has eight years' experience in this activity, and the thing he considers most difficult is transporting his sacks of potatoes, corn and peas, since they are very heavy and tiresome to carry. In the future, he hopes to buy more land to expand his production. This is his 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to his business' development. He is a very happy member of his community bank and always keep order at the meetings. With the loan of 3,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase fertilizer to make his lands more fertile.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica S. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old. Monica is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Monica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Monica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Monica is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Monica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  tiene 50 años, es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser trabajador. Está casado con Hilda, de 44 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ello David de 13 y Verónica de 11 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. El trabajo que desempeña, es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello. La siembra de papa en sus diferentes variedades, es su principal actividad, cuando sus sembríos están listos para ser cosechados, él los empaqueta y vende en el mercado central de su ciudad; pero no solo a eso se dedica Juan, ya que la crianza intensiva de animal vacuno y ovino; es lo que le divierte más; pues comparte con ello “sus animalitos” momentos de alegrías y tristezas. Cuenta que; los enseba y posteriormente vende su carne en pueblos aledaños de su localidad. Ahora él está planeando construir un cobertizo, con el cual podrá cuidar a sus animales del constante frío de la zona. Mientra sigue cuidando de sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “pericholi” y “yungay”; que dentro de este mes cosechará. Asimismo está previniendo su cosecha de alverja dentro de estos meses, por lo que está pesando fertilizar constantemente.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde agradece a su banco comunal que durante todo este tiempo trabajo con esmero y ahínco. Juan, comenta que  después del periodo de cosecha, sembrará papa de la variedad “yungay” y de “color”. Por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará semillas y también abono orgánico para que su próxima sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and a man characterized by his hard work. He is married to Hilda, 44, and together they have six children, although only two live with them: David, 13, and Verónica, 11. They live in their own house located in the rural zone of Santa Clara. He works is agriculture and has 20 years of experience. His principal activity is planting different varieties of potatoes. When his crops are ready to be harvested he packages them and sells them in the central market in his city. But that isn't his only work, as he also raises cows and sheep. This is the work he enjoys most, because he shares his happy and sad moments with his "animalitos" ["little animals"]. He says that he fattens them and later sells their meat in nearby villages, and that he is currently planning to construct a barn to shelter his animals from the region's constant cold.

In the meantime, he continues caring for his potato crops, which are currently of the “pericholi” and “yungay” varieties. He will harvest them within the month. He is also preparing to harvest his peas within a few months, so he is thinking he will fertilize them constantly.

He belongs to the "Trabajemos Unidos" ["We Work Together"] communal bank and this is his ninth loan with MFP.  Thanks to his communal bank he has worked this whole time with care and great effort. Juan says that after the harvest he will plant potatoes of the "yungay" and "color" varieties. That is why he will use the requested funds to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, so that his next harvest will be a success.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: María Martina

texts.es:
María Martina tiene 42 años, es soltera vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

María se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas además tiene 2 cabezas de ganado de vacas lecheras. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para la agricultura y alimentación para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar ganadería..

Le gusta lavar cocinar y conversar con la familia.
texts.en:
María Martina, 42, is single living with her parents in Guaranda Canton, Boilívar Province.  She has four children.

The NUCANCHI KAWSAY communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 15 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

María farms corn, wheat and potatoes and also has two heads of dairy cattle.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales at the wholesale market in that same city.  

She is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies and animal feed.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to improve the cattle raising.

She likes to wash, cook and chat with the family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 50 years old and has given birth to three sons. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints. Her husband is involved in the sweetmeat business. He runs a sweetmeat shop in the market where he offers good tasty sweetmeats to his customers; that’s why his sweetmeat products earn him good profits every month. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as milk, sugar, dried fruit and cooking oil etc  to make sweetmeats in larger quantity for sale.  

Naseem hopes that by investing loan money into her husband’s business her husband will be able to increase his profits. He has been in this business for the past 20 years.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for sweetmeat-making business.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.  Flordelis has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Flordelis has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money to  send her children to college and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 27 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school age children and one infant child. Christine has been engaged in a food vending business for five years. She sells viands and snacks at the school and offices everyday. She earns PHP 3,000 in this business. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for food preparation. Christine has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Christine hopes to have a food stall in their town.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Braulio Manuel

texts.es: Braulio tiene 31 años tiene 1 hijo de 4 años a su cargo. El es muy trabajador y emprendedor. Se dedica a vender ropa nueva, tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, emprendió su negocio para tener su dinero propio y proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios, el realiza la ofertas de sus productos de manera ambulante pues es la única forma  que tiene una gran cantidad de clientes. El sueño de Braulio es obtener un local en el mercado, pues es aquí donde circulan más clientes. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes y faldas.
texts.en: Braulio, 31, has a four-year-old son under his care.   A hard working and enterprising man, he has been earning a living selling new clothing for three years.  He started his business to earn his own money and provide his family with the necessary income.  In order to reach more customers he sells his products as a street vendor.  Braulio's goal is to set up a stall at the market where there are even more customers.  He plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.name: Nurgazy's Group

texts.en:
Nurgazy, age 20, is a member of this loan group. He is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. Nurgazy lives together with his parents, both of whom are pensioners. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds cattle and sells dairy products. Nurgazy has applied for the loan because he needs some additional financial funds in order to install a fence at the family home. In the future, he wants to have a successful business so as to be able to support his parents financially.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
– People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
– Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
– Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in central Asia, please join our Lending Team "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to install a fence at his home

loans.name: Jeison Franklin

texts.es:
El señor Jeison  Franklin vive en la ciudad de Managua y es padre de familia. Visitó Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito ya que ha tomado la decisión de mejorar su vivienda siendo las mejoras que va a hacer el levantamiento de una pared  y el piso de su vivienda. 

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de materiales tales como arena, bloque, cemento, y ladrillo.

Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionará a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeison Franklin lives in the city of Managua and he is the father of a family.

He visited our offices to request a loan following his decision to make improvements to his house. The improvements that Jeison will make are to install a new wall and to install a floor in his house.

The materials that he will purchase are sand, construction blocks, cement, and bricks.

It is important to mention that this project will help him provide his family with a dignified house where to live. It will also help him provide all the necessary living conditions in which to raise his children.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling sugar in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more sugar to sell. She says that she wants to buy cows and goats with the extra income from her loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar to sell

loans.name: Twikure Mu Bukene B Group

texts.fr:
Leonille fait partie du groupe Twikuremubukene B. Le nom du groupe signifie « chasser la pauvreté ». Leonille est née au Rwanda et a 50 ans. Elle est mariée avec 8 enfants de 5 à 25 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.
